commit_message:
Install the "classic" icinga interface

This patch installs the classic (mod_cgi-based) icinga web interface
providing us with a good place to start for systems-based monitoring
and giving us the ability to add more icinga goodness in future.

Change-Id: Idced49d2ada450d7948036a9f475c33e29d65712
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/23/87223/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux install-packages icinga-cgi # set check_external_commands sed -i "s/check_external_commands=0/check_external_commands=1/" /etc/icinga/icinga.cfg # fix a minior display issue if [ -f /etc/icinga/conf.d/extinfo_icinga.cfg ]; then sed -i "s/base\/debian/debian/g" /etc/icinga/conf.d/extinfo_icinga.cfg fi # set all servers as having ssh #sed -i '0,/ssh-servers/! s/localhost/*/' /etc/icinga/conf.d/hostgroups_icinga.cfg # some cleanup chmod g+x /var/lib/icinga/rw chmod g+x /var/lib/icinga ## Now icinga-cgi package is installed we need to install the configure scripts for apache # (this is shamlessly stolen from the Horizon source installation proceedures!) if [ -d /etc/httpd ]; then install -m 0644 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../files/icinga-cgi.conf /etc/httpd/conf.d/icinga-cgi.conf sed -e "s|HORIZON_VENV_DIR|$HORIZON_VENV_DIR|g" -i /etc/httpd/conf.d/icinga-cgi.conf fi if [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then install -m 0644 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../files/icinga-cgi.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available ln -s /etc/apache2/sites-available/icinga-cgi.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/icinga-cgi.conf ln -s /var/log/apache2 /var/log/httpd rm -f /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/{000-default.conf,default.conf,default-ssl.conf} fi

commit_message:
Ceilometer Service Update/Upgrade in TripleO

Support for an update/upgrade strategy that allows Ceilometer to
minimize the amount of data loss.

The event producing services are stopped (if running) and the queue
is drained and all the data in transit is stored to the database
from the collector agent.

When the collector has consumed all the data in the queue it is
restarted and subsequently all the event producing and querying
services are started.

Change-Id: I598d8ed6a92c8b4892d54f815dd664451d4c63f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/00/94500/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #Stop all the producer services if running #Check the ceilometer-agent-central is running POLLSTER_STATUS=$(service ceilometer-agent-central status | awk '{print $2}') echo $POLLSTER_STATUS if [[ $POLLSTER_STATUS == "start/running," ]]; then echo "Stopping ceilometer-agent-central" service ceilometer-agent-central stop fi #Check the ceilometer-agent-notification is running NOTIFIER_STATUS=$(service ceilometer-agent-notification status | awk '{print $2}') if [[ $NOTIFIER_STATUS == "start/running," ]]; then echo "Stopping ceilometer-agent-notification" service ceilometer-agent-notification stop fi #Check the ceilometer api is running API_STATUS=$(service ceilometer-api status | awk '{print $2}') if [[ $API_STATUS == "start/running," ]]; then echo "Stopping ceilometer-api" service ceilometer-api stop fi #Verify if the queue is running QUEUE_STATUS=$(rabbitmqctl list_queues name status | awk '{for(o=1;o<=NF;o++) if ($o ~ /metering.overcloud-controller/ ) {print $(o+1)} }') if [[ $QUEUE_STATUS == "running" ]]; then echo 'Metering Queue Running' COUNTER=0 #Verify if the queue still have messages that are unacknowledged while true; do UNACK=$(rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages messages_unacknowledged | awk '{for(o=1;o<=NF;o++) if ($o ~ /metering.overcloud-controller/ ) {print $(o+2)} }') echo 'Unacknowledged Messages = ' $UNACK if [[ $UNACK == 0 ]]; then echo "All messages in the queue have been consumed. Restarting Collector" break elif [[ "$COUNTER" -gt 2 ]]; then echo "Messages are taking too long to be consumed. Restarting Collector" break else # sleep to make sure collector has time to store all the messages to the db. COUNTER=$((COUNTER+1)) sleep $COUNTER fi done else echo 'Metering Queue Not Running' fi #Start all the previously stopped services service ceilometer-agent-central start service ceilometer-agent-notification start service ceilometer-api start

commit_message:
Install pkg-config to use ceilometer-agent-compute

Using ceilometer-agent-compute element causes DIB to fail during image
creation with the following error:

Exception: pkg-config binary is required to compile libvirt-python

Installing pkg-config package addresses this issue, hence pushing this
as a install.d command before trying to install libvirt-python.

Closes-Bug: #1350684
Change-Id: I6dbe588d4ac86c42403e4ec3bab589d326121029
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/06/110906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install-packages pkg-config libvirt-dev

commit_message:
Install check_mk server

This patchset compliments Ibc93bbb1f99efdde2792ece63f5cf332a2edddb7
and Idced49d2ada450d7948036a9f475c33e29d65712 in implementing the
check_mk server.

This creates the nova_access_info from a HEAT template and then
relies on this information to automatically build a list of nodes
to monitor from the output of nova list

Change-Id: I5c11017a025aee3bb43302c5d33dfd51ba9b48c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/26/87226/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eu # exit if we cann't source our required data DEFAULTS=/etc/icinga/nova_access_info [ -e $DEFAULTS ] || exit 0 source $DEFAULTS echo "defaults loaded." nova_ip_list=$(/usr/local/bin/nova list | awk -F"|" '/'$split_key'/ { split($7,x,"="); print x[2] }') echo "Found $nova_ip_list" for node_ip in $nova_ip_list do echo "setup cfg file for $node_ip." # TODO: make host_name & alias real names if [ ! -f /etc/check_mk/conf.d/$node_ip.mk ]; then cat << _EOF_ >> /etc/check_mk/conf.d/$node_ip.mk all_hosts = all_hosts + ["$node_ip"] _EOF_ fi /usr/bin/check_mk -II $node_ip done # enable livestatus if [ ! -f /etc/icinga/modules/livestatus.cfg ]; then echo "Enabling livestatus" cat << _EOF_ >> /etc/icinga/icinga.cfg broker_module=/usr/lib/check_mk/livestatus.o /var/lib/icinga/rw/live event_broker_options=-1 _EOF_ fi /usr/bin/check_mk -R

subject: configure keystone with apache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 04:59:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/1fdb99b8305061dfa8f8f069d75e6c37832211c0', 'message': 'configure keystone with apache

Change-Id: I03a577b7e88c9026e6fc3cd6839b6c75e8072925
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-24 19:53:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/5a7ac325ff006be0a23352e339f388a27bbdc9de', 'message': "configure keystone with apache

Allow configuration of keystone with Apache via environement variable.
Below are the reasons why we need Apache:

1.  Keystone federation support requires Apache. Federation can only be
supported in conjunction with Apache as it needs both mod_mellon and mod_shib.

2. Performance. Unlike Nova or Swift, Keystone is using eventlet with a
single thread instead of multiple worker processes. It can't handle the kind
of load we have in Public Cloud today with just 4 nodes per region. Apache
give us the flexibility to run multiple threads and multiple processes, and
therefore much better throughput. Though there are effects underway to make
Keystone a multi-worker process, those changes has not been landed and may
take time to mature.

3. SSL Authorization. HPCS security team mandates 2-way SSL for all service
communications. Since SSL client certificate already authenticate a given
service, there's no need for service to use a service token to validate user
tokens. We simply map the SSL client certificate attributes into Keystone
identity attributes to form a authorization context for API authorization.
Eventlet's SSL capability is inferior to Apache by far! You can't get the
client SSL certificate attributes from eventlet.

supported in conjunction with Apache as it needs both mod_mellon and mod_shib.

advantage of multi core node.  Apache give us the flexibility to run

certificate already authenticate a given service, there's no need
for service to use a service token to validate user tokens. We simply
map the SSL client certificate attributes into Keystone identity attributes
to form a authorization context for API authorization.  Eventlet's SSL
capability is inferior to Apache by far! You can't get the
client SSL certificate attributes from eventlet.

commit_message:
configure keystone with apache

Allow configuration of keystone with Apache via environement variable.
Below are the reasons why we need Apache:

1.  Keystone federation support requires Apache. Federation can only be
supported in conjunction with Apache as it needs both mod_mellon and mod_shib.

2. Performance. Unlike Nova or Swift, Keystone is using eventlet with a
single thread instead of multiple worker processes. So can't take
advantage of multi core node.  Apache give us the flexibility to run
multiple threads and multiple processes, and therefore much better
throughput. Though there are effects underway to make Keystone a
multi-worker process, those changes has not been landed and may
take time to mature.

3. SSL Authorization. Support for client certs.  Since SSL client
certificate already authenticate a given service, there's no need
for service to use a service token to validate user tokens. We simply
map the SSL client certificate attributes into Keystone identity attributes
to form a authorization context for API authorization.  Eventlet's SSL
capability is inferior to Apache by far! You can't get the
client SSL certificate attributes from eventlet.

Change-Id: I03a577b7e88c9026e6fc3cd6839b6c75e8072925

added_lines: #os-svc-daemon -i "$KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR" keystone keystone keystone-all "--config-dir /etc/keystone" if [ -z "$OVERCLOUD_KEYSTONE_APACHE" ] || [ $OVERCLOUD_KEYSTONE_APACHE -eq 0 ]; then os-svc-daemon -i "$KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR" keystone keystone keystone-all "--config-dir /etc/keystone" else if [ -d /etc/httpd ]; then install -m 0644 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../files/keystone.conf /etc/httpd/conf.d/keystone.conf sed -e "s|KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR|$KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR|g" -i /etc/httpd/conf.d/keystone.conf fi if [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then ln -s /opt/stack/keystone/httpd/keystone.py /etc/keystone/admin chmod 711 /etc/keystone install -m 0644 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../files/keystone.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available ln -s /etc/apache2/sites-available/keystone.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/keystone.conf ln -s ../mods-available/keystone.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/ssl.conf ln -s ../mods-available/keystone.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/ssl.load ln -s ../mods-available/keystone.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/socache_shmbc.load ln -s /var/log/apache2 /var/log/httpd rm -f /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/{000-default.conf,default.conf,default-ssl.conf} sed -e "s|KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR|$KEYSTONE_VENV_DIR|g" -i /etc/apache2/sites-available/keystone.conf fi fi

commit_message:
Refactors service url retrieval

This patch introduces functionality to set service URLs in the app.conf
file, either to:

- add service urls which aren't part of the serviceCatalog yet
- override service urls exposed through the serviceCatalog

Closes-Bug: 1586364

Change-Id: I730e3dea4f4b9f84d1974c7382f38ed70e57e315

commit_message:
Updating devstack plugin to filter for specific backport ubuntu versions

Working on LinuxMint was running into an issue where it was trying to add a
backport repository that didn't exist.  This adds some specific logic to filter
based on what specific ubuntu releases use backports.

Change-Id: I0ac652107dd328a03a1af0495c628dc05ff2b732
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/45/332445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${OFFLINE} == False && ${os_CODENAME} =~ (trusty|precise) ]]; then BACKPORT="deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu ${os_CODENAME}-backports main restricted universe multiverse"
deleted_lines: if [[ ${OFFLINE} == False ]]; then UBUNTU_CODENAME=$(lsb_release -cs) BACKPORT="deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu ${UBUNTU_CODENAME}-backports main restricted universe multiverse"

commit_message:
Use kojipkgs for diskimage-builder

* Use of kojipkgs decrease the time needed to receive ostree objects.
* Increase DIB_IMAGE_SIZE from 2 to 2.2 which was insufficient.

Change-Id: I074883b727bff4557915d520ee55c87cacde79ca

commit_message:
Purge soft-deleted instances cmd

This commit adds the functionality to purge soft-deleted
instances from the DB, along with data in tables
directly related to the soft-deleted instance.

Implements: blueprint purge-deleted-instances-cmd

Change-Id: Id0fce3c47749bcda28893e77ebef667c1c15a652
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/331350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.inspection import inspect as sqlalchemyinspectdef _related_fks_get(table_name): """For a given table name, return all the tables that have a foreign key relationship to the given table :param table_name: The table in which to find related tables :return: A list of Column sqlalchemy objects that represent a foreign key to the given provided table in table_name """ engine = get_engine() engine.connect() metadata = MetaData() metadata.bind = engine metadata.reflect(engine) ret = [] for table in metadata.sorted_tables: for col in table.columns: fkeys = col.foreign_keys or [] for fkey in fkeys: if fkey.column.table.name == table_name: ret.append(col) break return ret def _purge_records(query, model, context, dry_run, max_number=None): """Performs a deep delete of table records. This will find each related table, related by foreign key relationships, to the given table provided :param query: The query in which to execute :param model: The model in which the query represents :param context: DB context :param dry_run: If true, don't perform an actual delete :param max_number: The maximum number of records for the current request :return: """ fks = _related_fks_get(model.__tablename__) offset = 0 limit = 50 while True: if max_number is not None: if offset >= max_number: break elif limit > (max_number - offset): limit = max_number - offset q = query.limit(limit) if dry_run: q = q.offset(offset) results = q.all() results_len = len(results) offset += results_len if results_len <= 0: break for fk in fks: model_class = None found_model = false for model_class in six.itervalues(models.__dict__): if hasattr(model_class, "__tablename__"): if model_class.__tablename__ == fk.table.name: found_model = true break if found_model: for referenced_key in fk.foreign_keys: if (referenced_key.column.table.name == model.__tablename__): fk_ids = [x[referenced_key.column.name] for x in results] # In order for sqlalchemy to produce kosher SQL, # the actual fk attr needs to be used from the # sqlalchemy model class. method_attr = getattr(model_class, fk.name) related_model_query = model_query(context, model_class).\ filter(method_attr.in_(fk_ids)) _purge_records(related_model_query, model_class, context, dry_run) # The original 'query' can't be used for delete because a delete # is not allowed when a limit is set. Therefore, here I generate a # new query for deletion using the primary keys from the original # result set delete_query = model_query(context, model) pk_columns = [key.name for key in sqlalchemyinspect(model).primary_key] for pk_column in pk_columns: pk_attr = getattr(model, pk_column) delete_query = delete_query.filter( pk_attr.in_([x[pk_column] for x in results])) if not dry_run: delete_query.delete(synchronize_session='fetch') return offset @require_context @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=5, retry_on_deadlock=True) @pick_context_manager_writer def instances_purge_deleted(context, dry_run=False, older_than=90, max_number=None): purge_before = timeutils.utcnow() - datetime.timedelta(days=older_than) instance_query = model_query(context, models.Instance).\ filter(and_(models.Instance.deleted != 0, models.Instance.deleted_at < purge_before)) return _purge_records(instance_query, models.Instance, context, dry_run, max_number)

commit_message:
Purge soft-deleted instances cmd

This commit adds the functionality to purge soft-deleted
instances records from the DB, along with data in tables
directly related to the soft-deleted instance.

Implements: blueprint purge-deleted-instances-cmd

Change-Id: I3434debdf4df488e031e5218d30e49e5f8cb9e40

evo

commit_message:
Break apart configuration group scenario tests

The configuration group scenario tests were broken into separate
parts to facilitate parallel runs in the gate.

Change-Id: Id6f4b0a4060d6c88e547b62e74f97df881cf4425
Partial-Bug: #1571092

commit_message:
Replace print statment with print function

In PY3, print should used as a function instead of a statement.
This is PY27 compatible as well.

For example, instances of the first case were replaced by the
second case:

>>> print 'help'
  File "<stdin>", line 1
    print 'help'
               ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

>>> print('help')
help

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I21de65bc874d0fcfb51714857f8eaa97acb2f51d
Closes-bug: #1594741

commit_message:
Make set/unset commands in compute/image/common return normally when nothing specified

After this patch, all set/unset commands will return normally
when nothing specified.

Change-Id: Id94d0329faa1a674006a9aae901f834b41917317
Close-bug: #1588588

added_lines: import random class DontUpdateException(Exception): pass @contextlib.contextmanager def update_file(filename): old = open(filename, 'r') try: temp_filename = '%s.octane.%08x' % (filename, random.randrange(1 << 8 * 4)) new = open(temp_filename, 'wx') except IOError: # we're unlucky, try other name (or fail) temp_filename = '%s.octane.%08x' % (filename, random.randrange(1 << 8 * 4)) new = open(temp_filename, 'wx') with contextlib.nested(old, new): try: yield old, new except DontUpdateException: os.unlink(temp_filename) return except Exception: os.unlink(temp_filename) raise stat = os.stat(filename) os.chmod(temp_filename, stat.st_mode) os.chown(temp_filename, stat.st_uid, stat.st_gid) bak_filename = filename + '.octane.bak' os.rename(filename, bak_filename) os.rename(temp_filename, filename) os.unlink(bak_filename)

commit_message:
Determine routing before delete on neutron events

Since delete notifications don't contain the parent network_id, we can't
determine a routing id in these cases. project_id would be an
alternative choice for routing but doesn't cover cases where subnets can
be attached to another tenant's network (and thus routing by project_id
would leave unpredictable results).

Patch runs a search request to get the parent (and routing) id for
subnet and port deletes. Upstream patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/289050 will make this unnecessary if it
ever merges; at that point we can get the network_id from the payload.

Additionally fixes some issues in the index helper code related to
accessing metafields (_routing, _parent) in searches that changed
between ES 1.x and 2.x.

Closes-Bug: #1588540
Change-Id: I6d6ccfe47d50a489d0c8e6eff8fbd7a792687b25

commit_message:
Added the cgroups treshold paramter.

Broke the cgroups.rst file in multiple files by sections.
Added the recommended treshold parameters.

Change-Id: I311117ed7fde5f3a25ee82aa83d4dcea08ff107e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/87/329587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _cgroups-modify-multiple-nodes: Modify control groups for multiple nodes ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ You can modify ``cgroups`` for a particular process on multiple nodes by creating a separate file with the ``cgroups`` configuration, uploading the new configuration file to fuel, and restarting the ``cgroups`` task. You can modify control groups before or after you deploy an OpenStack environment. **To modify control groups for multiple nodes:** #. Log in to the Fuel Master node CLI. #. #. Download the Fuel configuration: .. code-block:: console fuel settings --env-id <id> --download #. Open the ``settings.yaml`` file for editing. #. Copy the ``cgroups`` section. #. Create a blank ``.yaml`` file. #. Paster the copied ``cgroups`` configuration into the file. #. Edit as required. #. Upload the new configuration file to Fuel: .. code-block:: console fuel settings --dir <path_to_new_yaml> --env-id <env_id> --upload #. Restart the ``cgroups`` task: .. code-block:: console fuel node --node-id <node_1> <node_2> <node_3> --tasks cgroups

commit_message:
Update the requirements to be in line with global

This change set updates the requirements to bring it in line with the
global-requirements from the core OpenStack.  It also removes the
netifaces dependency.  That is no longer required.

Change-Id: Ide5c5dbf85e9c2cd80182656f4bb505365c9962f

subject: Moving to freezer-manage to create/update/delete mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 13:27:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api/commit/d8a0bdac02cc1d36035e6fd3ed4af5db9b4f5396', 'message': 'Moving to freezer-manage to create/update/delete mappings

Use freezer-manage instead of freezer-db-init to create/update/delete
elasticsearch mappings. freezer-manage will add couple of more
functionalities. freezer-manage reads from the same configuration
file like freezer-api and uses the same db info.

How to use:

To create the mappings::

freezer-manage db sync

To update the mappings::

freezer-manage db update

To remove the mappings::

freezer-manage db remove

To print the mappings::

freezer-manage db show

To update settings:

freezer-manage db update-settings

Change-Id: Ib1f8265b780c1e2300bcba45183309ea06c673d3

commit_message:
Moving to freezer-manage to create/update/delete mappings

Use freezer-manage instead of freezer-db-init to create/update/delete
elasticsearch mappings. freezer-manage will add couple of more
functionalities. freezer-manage reads from the same configuration
file like freezer-api and uses the same db info.

How to use:

To create the mappings::

freezer-manage db sync

To update the mappings::

freezer-manage db update

To remove the mappings::

freezer-manage db remove

To print the mappings::

freezer-manage db show

To update settings:

freezer-manage db update-settings

Change-Id: Ib1f8265b780c1e2300bcba45183309ea06c673d3
Implements: blueprint move-to-freezer-manage
Closes-Bug: #1587408
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/29/324529/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: freezer-manage = freezer_api.cmd.manage:main

commit_message:
Remove remaining container_release properties

The lxc_container_create role has been updated to build containers to
the same distribution and release as the host machine. The
container_release property defined in environment files used to
generate inventory is no longer required.

I7d2aea8f6548feb381bf2354965f05fa0a9a99b8 removed this property from
half of the environment files. This change removes it from all remaining
files.

Change-Id: I8bff7613639676797159eac75cef0dd091bda7a4

commit_message:
Fuel-qa: Make assertions more informative

Implements blueprint: fuel-qa-assertions-enhancement

Change-Id: I4d61b7dbf0ed1ddc72cfd0b34ad6ba602b75af11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/55/298755/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Fuel-qa: Make assertions more informative ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/fuel-qa-assertions-enhancement This spec propouses changes in fuel-qa to enchance output of system_test.log and xunit xml file by adding custom exception classes for different types of errors. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- In current implementation of fuel-qa, assertion errors provide only small messages about what exactly was checked. And nearly all failed builds require an engineer to investigate the logs and code to answer what type of component or API was responsible for the issue. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- Add custom Exception classes for each type of possible error that can be identified by fuel-qa code. Examples: * FuelMasterSetupFailed * NodeProvisioningFailed * OSTFTestFailed * etc also use full path to the Exception in the code: fuel_qa.errors.FuelMasterSetupFailed These changes helps to separate product error from framework errors because all errors that are not defined in fuel_qa are errors of the framework code. Web UI ====== None Nailgun ======= None Data model ---------- None REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= None RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins ======= None Fuel Library ============ None ------------ Alternatives ------------ None -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: * Anton Studenov (astudenov): astudenov@mirantis.com Other contributors: * Dennis Dmitriev (ddmitriev): ddmitriev@mirantis.com * Dmitry Tyzhnenko (dtyzhnenko): dtyzhnenko@mirantis.com * Kirill Rozin (krozin): krozin@mirantis.com Mandatory design review: None Work Items ========== - Investigate the existing code to find list of errors which can be identified - Make the changes in fuel-qa Dependencies ============ None ------------ Testing, QA ------------ None Acceptance criteria =================== - TBD ---------- References ---------- None

commit_message:
Move methods to utils.py

This moves (and makes public) _get_from_stdin() and
_handle_json_or_file_arg() from node_shell.py to
common/utils.py so that it can be used by the osc
(openstackclient) plugin code too.

Change-Id: I4b10a04b459b8206a20d258a255f9c882548be1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/89/332489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys def get_from_stdin(info_desc): """Read information from stdin. :param info_desc: A string description of the desired information :raises: InvalidAttribute if there was a problem reading from stdin :returns: the string that was read from stdin """ try: info = sys.stdin.read().strip() except Exception as e: err = _("Cannot get %(desc)s from standard input. Error: %(err)s") raise exc.InvalidAttribute(err % {'desc': info_desc, 'err': e}) return info def handle_json_or_file_arg(json_arg): """Attempts to read JSON argument from file or string. :param json_arg: May be a file name containing the JSON, or a JSON string. :returns: A list or dictionary parsed from JSON. :raises: InvalidAttribute if the argument cannot be parsed. """ if os.path.isfile(json_arg): try: with open(json_arg, 'r') as f: json_arg = f.read().strip() except Exception as e: err = _("Cannot get JSON from file '%(file)s'. " "Error: %(err)s") % {'err': e, 'file': json_arg} raise exc.InvalidAttribute(err) try: json_arg = json.loads(json_arg) except ValueError as e: err = (_("For JSON: '%(string)s', error: '%(err)s'") % {'err': e, 'string': json_arg}) raise exc.InvalidAttribute(err) return json_arg

commit_message:
Added qg-*, sg-* and vhu-* ports as default in included_interface_re.

By default router ports(qg-*), SG ports (sg-* VM SNAT traffic) and
VHU(vhost-user) ports for DPDK environment are enabled in
included_interface_re field in ovs.yaml.

Removed tap-* ports and qr-* ports to avoid data bloating.
If user still wants to configure the non default port they can
configure in ovs.yaml file and restart the monasca-gent to collect
the metrics.

Change-Id: I0984c8f1c2fb7d95fdb4da35bbc2214c51f82ba2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/44/330344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: included_interface_re = 'qg.*|vhu.*|sg.*'
deleted_lines: # Installations that don't allow usage of sudo should copy the `ovs-vsctl` # command to another location and use the `setcap` command to allow the # monasca-agent to run that command. The new location of the `ovs-vsctl` # command should be what is set in the config file for `ovs_cmd`.included_interface_re = 'tap.*|qr.*|qg.*|vhu.*'

commit_message:
Add a note for policy enforcement by user_id

The policy enforcement by user_id isn't supported by Nova, add a
note to devref to clarify that.

Change-Id: I11aece03f28a8cbe3d37681f49e4325689999142
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/332643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Policy Enforcement by user_id ----------------------------- In the legacy v2 API, the policy enforces with target object, and some operators implement user-based authorization based on that. Actually only project-based authorization is well tested, the user based authorization is untested and isn't supported by Nova. In the future, the nova will remove all the supports for user-based authorization.

commit_message:
Test out the new isoformat function (WIP)

Change-Id: I0dcf8066bb3b15a03b712f2a2f58401735b03f15
Depends-On: Ifb367a1f96a663a1d54b1770b9d20bbffdba491c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/83/331883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return timeutils.isoformat(at=at, subsecond=subsecond)
deleted_lines: # Python provides a similar instance method for datetime.datetime objects # called isoformat(). The format of the strings generated by isoformat() # have a couple of problems: # 1) The strings generated by isotime are used in tokens and other public # APIs that we can't change without a deprecation period. The strings # generated by isoformat are not the same format, so we can't just # change to it. # 2) The strings generated by isoformat do not include the microseconds if # the value happens to be 0. This will likely show up as random failures # as parsers may be written to always expect microseconds, and it will # parse correctly most of the time. if not at: at = timeutils.utcnow() st = at.strftime(_ISO8601_TIME_FORMAT if not subsecond else _ISO8601_TIME_FORMAT_SUBSECOND) tz = at.tzinfo.tzname(None) if at.tzinfo else 'UTC' st += ('Z' if tz == 'UTC' else tz) return st

commit_message:
Add error message when 'quickstart.sh localhost' is run under 'root'

quickstart.sh assumes to be run by non-root in case of localhost,
hence the patch add to show error message and exit in case of EUID=0.

Change-Id: Ic7cf13a68e5a83a1abc3ca5c69ef73cf282ee4bc
Closes-Bug: #1591832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/11/331511/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ${EUID:-${UID}} = 0]; then echo "ERROR: $0 should be run by non-root user." >&2 exit fi

commit_message:
use the ansible-role-tripleo-inventory to override native inventory

* This change will include an inventory of the overcloud nodes.
This will allow ansible to execute on the overcloud nodes and
collect logs from the entire environment.

Change-Id: I3ea5ea1eba5f0e40e618bd7ae1410c25f8191ddf

commit_message:
Improve partitions and disk metadata handling

Partitions schema and disk metadata at nodes must be updated only
if they are scheduled for reprovisioning, and the provisioning
method has changed to incompatible (i.e. from 'cobbler' to 'image')
due to the shift of release version.

Move logic that manages partitions from upgrade handlers to function
that actually initiates the re-provisioning of node. This ensures
that for every node this is applied only once and only if necessary.

Change-Id: I28718564543e3ccd92d985bd79c76e509e8eae1f
Closes-bug: 1585938
Closes-bug: 1575054

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from octane.util import disk as disk_util def test_create_partition(mocker, mock_ssh_call, mock_ssh_call_output, node): test_size = 1 test_disk = 'disk' mock_node = node mock_part_end = mocker.patch("octane.util.disk.parse_last_partition_end") mock_part_end.return_value = 1 disk_util.create_partition(test_disk, test_size, mock_node) mock_ssh_call_output.assert_called_once_with( ['parted', '/dev/%s' % test_disk, 'unit', 'MB', 'print'], node=node) mock_ssh_call.assert_called_once_with( ['parted', '/dev/%s' % test_disk, 'unit', 'MB', 'mkpart', 'custom', 'ext4', str(2), str(3)], node=node) def test_update_partition_info(mocker, node): test_node_id = 1 container = 'nailgun' mock_run_in_container = mocker.patch( "octane.util.docker.run_in_container") expected_command = [ 'python', os.path.join('/tmp', 'update_node_partition_info.py'), str(test_node_id), ] disk_util.update_node_partition_info(test_node_id) mock_run_in_container.assert_called_once_with(container, expected_command) NODE_DISKS_ATTRIBUTE = [ { 'id': 'test-1', 'name': 'disk1', }, { 'id': 'test-2', 'name': 'disk2', } ] def test_create_configdrive_partition(mocker, node): size = 10 name = 'disk1' node.mock_add_spec(['get_attribute']) node.get_attribute.return_value = NODE_DISKS_ATTRIBUTE mock_create_part = mocker.patch("octane.util.disk.create_partition") disk_util.create_configdrive_partition(node) mock_create_part.assert_called_once_with(name, size, node)

commit_message:
add ssh util functions

get_files_from_remote_node

get list of files from remote host

Usage:

from octane.util import ssh
from fuelclient.objects import node

files = [
    # (remote_path, local_path)
]

node = ... # get required node.Node object

ssh.get_files_from_remote_node(node, files)

put_files_to_remote_node

put list of files from remote host

Usage:

from octane.util import ssh
from fuelclient.objects import node

files = [
    # (local_path, remote_path)
]

node = ... # get required node.Node object

ssh.get_files_from_remote_node(node, files)

Change-Id: I03021b3e9502801cde77a88f64cb36438c714445
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/27/332027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_files_from_remote_node(node, remote_and_local_path_pairs): sftp_client = sftp(node) for remote_path, local_path in remote_and_local_path_pairs: sftp_client.get(remote_path, local_path) def put_files_to_remote_node(node, local_and_remote_path_pairs): sftp_client = sftp(node) for local_path, remote_path in local_and_remote_path_pairs: sftp_client.put(local_path, remote_path)

commit_message:
Function to create config-drive partition

Add function to create partition for config-drive to util/disk.py
module. This is required to switch from 'cobbler' to 'image'
provision method.

Change-Id: Ia52195a2e25e4e459c8947eb2dfaea97195dbe7f
Related-bug: 1575054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/95/321495/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_configdrive_partition(self): disks = get_node_disks(self.node) if not disks: raise Exception("No disks info was found " "for node {0}".format(self.node["id"])) # it was agreed that 10MB is enough for config drive partition size = 10 create_partition(disks[0]['name'], size, self.node)

commit_message:
Move Resource exceptions to common module (1)

It is convenient to have all exceptions in exception module.
Also it is reduces namespace cluttering of resource module and decreases
the number of dependencies in other modules (we do not need to import resource
in some cases for now).
UpdateReplace exception is moved in this patch.

Change-Id: Ief441ca2022a0d50e88d709d1a062631479715b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/69/219669/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name) with self._action_recorder(action, exception.UpdateReplace): raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name)
deleted_lines: class UpdateReplace(Exception): '''Raised when resource update requires replacement.''' def __init__(self, resource_name='Unknown'): msg = _("The Resource %s requires replacement.") % resource_name super(Exception, self).__init__(six.text_type(msg)) raise UpdateReplace(self.name) raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self.name) with self._action_recorder(action, UpdateReplace): raise UpdateReplace(self.name)

commit_message:
Adding debugging documentation for Memcached

Change-Id: I924bdc2da5b545d84544fda9ed350dedb1e435ab
Partially-implements: blueprint documentation-initialization
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/66/330766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _mariadb-guide: ============================= Memcached in Kolla-Kubernetes ============================= Overview ======== `Memcached <https://memcached.org/>_ is the default persistant cache for a `Kolla-Kubernetes cluster. Preparation and Deployment ========================== Memcached is self-sufficent, thus it's one of the first things you want to start while installing. Memcache does not require bootstrapping. To create the Replication Controller that will keep Memcached running:: kolla-kubernetes start memcached Verify Operation ================ To find the IP address of the kubernetes service so you can test for functionality on a machine inside of the Kubernetes cluster (e.g. running Kube-proxy) but not running as a container:: kubectl get svc memcached Once you know the IP address and port, you can check to see if memcached is responding to requests by replacing <ADDRESS> with the address of the memcached service:: echo "stats settings" | nc <ADDRESS> 11211 You should see output looking like this::: STAT maxbytes 67108864 STAT maxconns 1024 STAT tcpport 11211 STAT udpport 11211 STAT inter 0.0.0.0 STAT verbosity 2 STAT oldest 0 STAT evictions on STAT domain_socket NULL STAT umask 700 STAT growth_factor 1.25 STAT chunk_size 48 STAT num_threads 4 STAT num_threads_per_udp 4 STAT stat_key_prefix : STAT detail_enabled no STAT reqs_per_event 20 STAT cas_enabled yes STAT tcp_backlog 1024 STAT binding_protocol auto-negotiate STAT auth_enabled_sasl no STAT item_size_max 1048576 STAT maxconns_fast no STAT hashpower_init 0 STAT slab_reassign no STAT slab_automove 0 STAT lru_crawler no STAT lru_crawler_sleep 100 STAT lru_crawler_tocrawl 0 STAT tail_repair_time 0 STAT flush_enabled yes STAT hash_algorithm jenkins STAT lru_maintainer_thread no STAT hot_lru_pct 32 STAT warm_lru_pct 32 STAT expirezero_does_not_evict no END Debug an Instance ================= TODO: Fill in more details

added_lines: Ansible 2.00 none On deployment host.. NOTE:: Kolla (which provides the templating) is sensitive about the Ansible version. Mainline currently requires 2.0.x or above.Kolla-kubernetes works against Kolla mainline's containers but you need to build them.
deleted_lines: Ansible 2.00 < 2.1.0 On deployment host.. NOTE:: Kolla (which provides the templating) is *very* sensitive about the Ansible version. Mainline currently requires 2.0.x. Newer versions (2.1 or higher) will fail to work, as will pre 2.0 versions.Kolla-kubernetes doesn't work against any released version of Kolla presently. Furthermore, until `patch 320744 <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320744/>`_ and `patch 321529 <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321529/>`_ are merged, it won't work against mainline.

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I2ff10f4b89b6505dfeecb747f438246a57abaf67

commit_message:
Break apart database scenario tests

The database actions group scenario tests were broken into separate parts
to facilitate parallel runs in the gate.

Initialized instance delete action was also broken down into
delete call itself and the wait for it to finish.

Change-Id: I9f3064f26d83f33e351b6d77b32c7bde4de3eb88
Partial-Bug: 1571092

commit_message:
Reduce setup overhead in auth_plugin tests

The test runtimes have been cut in half by lowering the amount of excess
setup run by each test.

Change-Id: I96ae7c694e22d87d55d1f24db0e6cac4b941a9a9

added_lines: from keystone import auth class LoadAuthPlugins(fixtures.Fixture): def __init__(self, *method_names): super(LoadAuthPlugins, self).__init__() self.method_names = method_names self.saved = {} def setUp(self): super(LoadAuthPlugins, self).setUp() #if auth.controllers.AUTH_PLUGINS_LOADED: # raise Exception('auth_plugins already loaded') AUTH_METHODS = auth.controllers.AUTH_METHODS for method_name in self.method_names: if method_name in AUTH_METHODS: self.saved[method_name] = AUTH_METHODS[method_name] AUTH_METHODS[method_name] = auth.controllers.load_auth_method( method_name) auth.controllers.AUTH_PLUGINS_LOADED = True def cleanup(): for method_name in list(AUTH_METHODS): if method_name in self.saved: AUTH_METHODS[method_name] = self.saved[method_name] else: del AUTH_METHODS[method_name] auth.controllers.AUTH_PLUGINS_LOADED = False self.addCleanup(cleanup)

commit_message:
Separete notification object version test

Move the version test of the notification objects to a separate
test case to avoid mixing normal and notification ovos.

Change-Id: I997235020f28adadaa2e8772ec888e2f1bf7f3ef
Partially-Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-newton
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/27/331727/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collectionsfrom oslo_versionedobjects import fixturefrom nova.tests.unit.objects import test_objects notification_object_data = { 'EventType': '1.0-21dc35de314fc5fc0a7965211c0c00f7', 'NotificationPublisher': '1.0-bbbc1402fb0e443a3eb227cc52b61545', 'ServiceStatusNotification': '1.0-a73147b93b520ff0061865849d3dfa56', 'ServiceStatusPayload': '1.0-a5e7b4fd6cc5581be45b31ff1f3a3f7f', } class TestNotificationObjectVersions(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(test.NoDBTestCase, self).setUp() base.NovaObjectRegistry.register_notification_objects() def test_versions(self): checker = fixture.ObjectVersionChecker( base.NovaObjectRegistry.obj_classes()) notification_object_data.update(test_objects.object_data) expected, actual = checker.test_hashes(notification_object_data) self.assertEqual(expected, actual, 'Some notification objects have changed; please make ' 'sure the versions have been bumped, and then update ' 'their hashes here.') def test_notification_payload_version_depends_on_the_schema(self): @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register_if(False) class TestNotificationPayload(notification.NotificationPayloadBase): VERSION = '1.0' SCHEMA = { 'field_1': ('source_field', 'field_1'), 'field_2': ('source_field', 'field_2'), } fields = { 'extra_field': fields.StringField(), # filled by ctor 'field_1': fields.StringField(), # filled by the schema 'field_2': fields.IntegerField(), # filled by the schema } checker = fixture.ObjectVersionChecker( {'TestNotificationPayload': (TestNotificationPayload,)}) old_hash = checker.get_hashes(extra_data_func=get_extra_data) TestNotificationPayload.SCHEMA['field_3'] = ('source_field', 'field_3') new_hash = checker.get_hashes(extra_data_func=get_extra_data) self.assertNotEqual(old_hash, new_hash) def get_extra_data(obj_class): extra_data = tuple() # Get the SCHEMA items to add to the fingerprint # if we are looking at a notification if issubclass(obj_class, notification.NotificationPayloadBase): schema_data = collections.OrderedDict( sorted(obj_class.SCHEMA.items())) extra_data += (schema_data,) return extra_data

commit_message:
Verify network template sanity before loading

Open file with network template and load it as YaML. Fail, log
and raise exception if any error occurs opening the file.

Change-Id: Ie516749c832c23bb739ebb5d02dd9bd5a9807b7f
Closes-bug: 1583063

commit_message:
Add function for checking sanity of nodes to upgrade

Move sanity checks logic for upgrading node into separate
function.

Change-Id: Ifa46753f0bed18a0e25887c2a07445145011dad4
Related-bug: 1583063

added_lines: from octane.commands import upgrade_node def test_check_sanity(mocker, node): test_cluster_id = 'test-env' mock_env_data = { 'id': test_cluster_id, } mock_node_data = { 'id': 'test-node', 'cluster': None, } mock_env = mocker.Mock() mock_node = mocker.Mock() mock_env.data = mock_env_data mock_node.data = mock_node_data mock_nodes = [mock_node, ] res = upgrade_node.check_sanity(mock_env, mock_nodes) assert res

commit_message:
libvirt: enhance method to return pointer_model from image prop

Gives the opportunity to set the pointer type from image properties.

Implements: blueprint virt-configure-usb-tablet-from-image

Change-Id: I11d3e031c202c39258263212401a0f035ec67d88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/174854/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: agent_enabled=False, image_meta=None): return drvr._get_guest_usb_tablet(os_type, image_meta) def test_get_guest_usb_tablet_image_meta(self): self.flags(use_usb_tablet=False, group='libvirt') image_meta = {"properties": {"hw_use_usb_tablet": "true"}} tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( True, True, vm_mode.HVM, image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNotNone(tablet) tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( True, False, vm_mode.HVM, image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNotNone(tablet) tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( False, True, vm_mode.HVM, image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNotNone(tablet) tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( False, False, vm_mode.HVM, image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNone(tablet) tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( True, True, "foo", image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNone(tablet) tablet = self._test_get_guest_usb_tablet( False, True, vm_mode.HVM, True, image_meta=image_meta) self.assertIsNone(tablet)

subject: Use the ldap fixture to simplify tests

* Do not cleanup neutron items during DB migration

commit_message:
Add warning for invalid parameters

Currently, when a parameter is formatted wrong sphinx dies with a
cryptic error message:

    AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'items'

This happens because the parameter is not recognized as dict.

This patch adds a check that ensures parameters are formatted correctly
by verifying that they're dicts.

Change-Id: I0140336cdcd9fd1d356d1fa50fd8dd15790ef8bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref refs/changes/66/324366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not isinstance(paramlist, dict): self.env.warn( "%s:%s" % ( self.state_machine.node.source, self.state_machine.node.line), ("Invalid parameter definition ``%s``. Expected " "format: ``name: reference``. " " Skipping." % paramlist)) continue

commit_message:
Use Zaqar signed URLs in software deployment

Instead of using a token that we need to create every time to poll the
Zaqar queue, create a signature and use it as an authentication
mechanism.

Change-Id: Ibf9f6c334eba024f6faa7d6bb708d6d9f778ee43

commit_message:
Notify operators that cinder + LVM doesn't work

Cinder has closed a flaw in the design of either glance, cinder, or
OpenStack in general.  Whatever the case is, LVM + multi-controller
doesn't work correctly.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ibe3445699cfdb1622279a85b6c4e612663d08def
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/28/332228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note :: The Cinder community has closed a bug as WontFix which makes it impossible for LVM to be used at all in a multi-controller setup. The only option for multi-controller storage to work correctly at present is via a Ceph deployment. If community members disagree with this decision, please report the specific use case in the Cinder bug tracker here: `_bug 306756 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/306756>`__.

commit_message:
Prevent unexpected exception if provision fail

Squashed commits from the 9.0:
- 79f99adf48de37d33b5e089472f91b2f7e614e55
  - fault tolerance for uploading errors
  - use upload file task instead of magnet directly
- e07e74eb5980421b47fbc64b6d6f50a955e7cad1
  - do not fail if no nodes were sent to reboot

Change-Id: I5b806f3d1411c4445a58b899b73eca035f5931b9
Closes-Bug: #1546604
Related-Bug: #1540360
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/70/322770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uids_to_provision, failed_uids = upload_provision(ctx, nodes) run_provision(ctx, uids_to_provision, failed_uids) rescue => e msg = "Error while provisioning: message: #{e.message} trace: #{e.format_backtrace}" Astute.logger.error("#{ctx.task_id}: #{msg}") report_error(ctx, msg) def self.upload_provision(ctx, nodes) failed_uids = [] nodes.each do |node| succees = upload_provision_data(ctx, node) next if succees failed_uids << node['uid'] Astute.logger.error("#{ctx.task_id}: Upload provisioning data " \ "failed on node #{node['uid']}. Provision on such node will " \ "not start") end uids_to_provision = nodes.select { |n| !failed_uids.include?(n['uid']) } .map { |n| n['uid'] } [uids_to_provision, failed_uids] def self.upload_provision_data(ctx, node) Astute.logger.debug("#{ctx.task_id}: uploading provision " \ "data on node #{node['uid']}: #{node.to_json}") upload_task = Astute::UploadFile.new( generate_upload_provision_task(node), ctx ) upload_task.sync_run end def self.generate_upload_provision_task(node) { "id" => 'upload_provision_data', "node_id" => node['uid'], "parameters" => { "path" => '/tmp/provision.json', "data" => node.to_json, "user_owner" => 'root', "group_owner" => 'root', "overwrite" => true } } end def self.run_provision(ctx, uids, failed_uids) results = run_shell_command( ctx, uids, 'flock -n /var/lock/provision.lock provision', Astute.config.provisioning_timeout ) results.select{ |_node_id, result| !result }.keys.each do |node_id| failed_uids << node_id Astute.logger.error("#{ctx.task_id}: Provision command returned " \ "non zero exit code on node: #{node_id}") end failed_uids if node_ids.empty? Astute.logger.warn("No nodes were sent to reboot for " \ "task: #{task_id}") return end def self.run_shell_command(context, node_uids, cmd, timeout=3600) shell = MClient.new( context, 'execute_shell_command', node_uids, check_result=true, timeout=timeout, retries=1 ) results = shell.execute(:cmd => cmd) results.inject({}) do |summary, node| summary.merge(node.results[:sender] => node.results[:data][:exit_code] == 0) end rescue MClientTimeout, MClientError => e Astute.logger.error("#{context.task_id}: cmd: #{cmd} " \ "mcollective error: #{e.message}") {} end
deleted_lines: begin # uploading provisioning data "/tmp/provision.json" nodes.each { |node| upload_provision(ctx, node) } # running provisioning script results = run_provision(ctx, nodes) results.each do |node| unless node.results[:data][:exit_code] == 0 failed = node.results[:sender] Astute.logger.error("#{ctx.task_id}: Provision command returned non zero exit code on node: #{failed}") failed_uids << failed end end rescue => e msg = "Error while provisioning: message: #{e.message} trace: #{e.format_backtrace}" Astute.logger.error("#{ctx.task_id}: #{msg}") report_error(ctx, msg) end def self.upload_provision(ctx, node) Astute.logger.debug "#{ctx.task_id}: uploading provision data: #{node.to_json}" client = MClient.new(ctx, "uploadfile", [node['uid']]) client.upload(:path => '/tmp/provision.json', :content => node.to_json, :user_owner => 'root', :group_owner => 'root', :overwrite => true) def self.run_provision(ctx, nodes) uids = nodes.map { |node| node['uid'] } shell = MClient.new(ctx, 'execute_shell_command', uids, check_result=true, timeout=3600, retries=1) shell.execute(:cmd => 'flock -n /var/lock/provision.lock /usr/bin/provision')

subject: Clean RabbitMQ definitions file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 14:52:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/60da52ac4446bbe5542688aa20b85887f45fe368', 'message': "Clean RabbitMQ definitions file

Added a script to clean up the rabbitmq definitions file which is
being generated during the post-deployment phase of a deployment.
Previosly the definitions file contained all RPC queues presented in
RabbitMQ after the successful deployment. These queues are one-off, and
their restoration via OCF-script leads to growth of unconsumed messages,
which, in turn, lead to RabbitMQ slowness and malfunctions.

This is a rework of the previously reverted change
Ie3f3194b3eaaa8dc28d1cd3442090b586e177306 which caused deployment
failures in some scenarios involving partial update. This happened
because the script was delivered in a separate package which has not
been updated during the partial update. Now the script is
delivered in the puppet's directory instead. Also introduced
additional regexp-matching logic to instantly remove all the RPC queues,
which were left in the previous version of the fix.

Change-Id: Ib2f8237692d7dab47b83ac886ff370686a5d22fe
Closes-Bug: #1497961

commit_message:
Clean RabbitMQ definitions file

Added a script to clean up the rabbitmq definitions file which is
being generated during the post-deployment phase of a deployment.
Previosly the definitions file contained all RPC queues presented in
RabbitMQ after the successful deployment. These queues are one-off, and
their restoration via OCF-script leads to growth of unconsumed messages,
which, in turn, lead to RabbitMQ slowness and malfunctions.

This is a rework of the previously reverted change
Ie3f3194b3eaaa8dc28d1cd3442090b586e177306 which caused deployment
failures in some scenarios involving partial update. This happened
because the script was delivered in a separate package which has not
been updated during the partial update. Now the script is
delivered in the puppet's directory instead. Also introduced
additional regexp-matching logic to instantly remove all the RPC queues,
which were left in the previous version of the fix.

Change-Id: Ib2f8237692d7dab47b83ac886ff370686a5d22fe
Closes-Bug: #1497961

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated ips on network topology

Do a check to see if the ip is already on the device
ip_addresses list before pushing it to prevent having
duplicated ips when the ports status changes.

Change-Id: I0a526f37faa2ef757cd5474c43264795d6b758ae
Closes-Bug: 1543312

commit_message:
Insert 'rgw_frontends' parameter with default value into ceph.conf

In fuel-library, parameter 'rgw_frontends' was added to ceph.conf
file in version 8.0. This parameter always takes default value
and cannot be managed by deployment configuration engine (nailgun).

Add a line containing this parameter to the ceph.conf file while
moving it to upgraded controller. Set parameter to default value.

Change-Id: I19866f6e9c1b7590c017f471cb11e78c72102136
Closes-bug: 1575689
(cherry picked from commit 65e13c9a2a2edb015279f34d8965ee0c4a2d77d1)

commit_message:
Insert 'rgw_frontends' parameter with default value into ceph.conf

In fuel-library, parameter 'rgw_frontends' was added to ceph.conf
file in version 8.0. This parameter always takes default value
and cannot be managed by deployment configuration engine (nailgun).

Add a line containing this parameter to the ceph.conf file while
moving it to upgraded controller. Set parameter to default value.

Change-Id: I19866f6e9c1b7590c017f471cb11e78c72102136
Closes-bug: 1575689
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/57/321457/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
def add_rgw_frontends(conf): rgw_frontends_line = ("rgw_frontends = fastcgi socket_port=9000 " "socket_host=127.0.0.1") conf = re.sub(r'
keyring = /etc/ceph/keyring.radosgw.gateway
', "
g<1>{0}
".format(rgw_frontends_line), conf) return conf conf = add_rgw_frontends(conf)

commit_message:
Add python-cardox package to controllers

python-cardox is required by gnocchi when configured to use ceph
backend. So this change helps get this package install via puppet.

Change-Id: I13879b0026091b70e7c80f577c855ff666b1e3c6

commit_message:
Case sensitive errors in Networking-sfc documentation

Case sensitive Typo
Link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-sfc/api.html
In documentation instead of "p6" it is typed as "P6" and same way 
instead of "p1" it is typed as "P1"

Change-Id: I41668b99bbaa55fc2e0f1425bcea9277a5275186
Closes-Bug: #1594742

commit_message:
Make dict.keys() PY3 compatible

The dict.keys()[0] will raise a TypeError in PY3, as dict.keys()
doesn't return a list any more in PY3 but a view of list.

Change-Id: I0a7a1fbbcd8394dbe100a50b23126897c2da3865
Closes-Bug: #1583419

commit_message:
Fix functional tests

The functional tests in IPA were broken because the configuration
options weren't loaded prior to starting the service. This patch does
now register the configuration option at the base class.

Closes-Bug: #1595145
Change-Id: Iaaa16fddd093075e7f995fb82ad3abb64e8e5794
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/55/332755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Release repos list/update

Fuel releases contain metadata including default
set of rpm/deb repositories that are to be used
during cluster deployment. This change introduces
couple new subcommands that allow to view and change
the list of release repositories.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ied9d69b98345318d7a92ca4c7093ac0424599cc3
Implements: blueprint fuelclient-modify-release-repos

commit_message:
Exporting Network Interface Product and Vendor ID to Inspector

Patch enables passing Product and Vendor ID to Inspector. These parameter
could be exposed using the Port's "extra" field.
Product id, enables to identify the capabilities of the device(ex, does the
device has SR-IOV capabilities or not), which would help in creating heat
template or building images using diskimage builder.

Patch generalizes the _get_device_vendor function, enabling it to be used with
both block and net devices and add new function _get_device_vendor to get
product id.
Adds two attributes vendor_id, product_id to NetworkInterface class.

Closes-Bug: #1594196
Change-Id: Ifbbb4d630962ebc0b654b09cc074d0a3e4335074
Signed-off-by: yogananth subramanian <ysubrama@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support OS_PROJECT_* env variables

OS_TENANT_NAME and OS_TENANT_ID are legacy variables.
so OS_PROJECT_NAME and OS_PROJECT_ID should be supported.

Change-Id: Ibdfa0e14d80313b8087670ccd0bd9bdbf5ba364d
Closes-Bug: #1591027

commit_message:
Move SSL related options to api.pp

Most of the other services configure their SSL options in the api.pp.
So for consistency, they were moved here too. The old SSL parameters
have been kept for backwards compatibility, so they should still
work.

Change-Id: I82d9faa4113c4007402954bb2e89e3ef8e020c7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/11/330511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*use_ssl*] # (optinal) Enable SSL on the API server # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*cert_file*] # (optinal) certificate file to use when starting api server securely # defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*key_file*] # (optional) Private key file to use when starting API server securely # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*ca_file*] # (optional) CA certificate file to use to verify connecting clients # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $use_ssl = $::os_service_default, $cert_file = $::os_service_default, $key_file = $::os_service_default, $ca_file = $::os_service_default, $use_ssl_real = pick($::neutron::use_ssl, $use_ssl) $cert_file_real = pick($::neutron::cert_file, $cert_file) $key_file_real = pick($::neutron::key_file, $key_file) $ca_file_real = pick($::neutron::ca_file, $ca_file) if ! is_service_default($use_ssl_real) and ($use_ssl_real) { if is_service_default($cert_file_real) { fail('The cert_file parameter is required when use_ssl is set to true') } if is_service_default($key_file_real) { fail('The key_file parameter is required when use_ssl is set to true') } } if ! is_service_default($use_ssl_real) and !($use_ssl_real) { if ! is_service_default($ca_file_real) and ($ca_file_real) { fail('The ca_file parameter requires that use_ssl to be set to true') } } # SSL Options neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/use_ssl': value => $use_ssl_real; 'ssl/cert_file': value => $cert_file_real; 'ssl/key_file': value => $key_file_real; 'ssl/ca_file': value => $ca_file_real; }

commit_message:
Fix order of imports

oslo_* imports belong to 3rd party libraries and should be imported
before local imports.

Change-Id: I5773343ef53741c28414fa738b90717f5eacab53
Partial-Bug: #1594850

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated network_resources module

tempest has removed the network_resources module in the recent
commit causing gate to fail. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: I582ddb06464ef7290b1595ac59b8ffdfdf7bade4
(cherry picked from commit 88f4a87f4899fc29e9dde6482ceb2a0e42896ece)

commit_message:
WADL to RST migration (part 1)

This brings the Images API Reference to the glance tree as part of
the effort described here:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Migrate#API_Reference_Plan

This patch introduces (a) the tox environment to generate the api-ref,
and (b) the content of the Images v1 API reference converted to RST.
The content has been corrected where I noticed divergences with reality.

Note to reviewers: The conversion project is ongoing, that is, the doc
team is continuing to develop tools (for example, to display the response
codes in a table) and converging on a style for these docs.  So this isn't
a final product, there will be more patches later.  While this patch is
not perfect, it is pareto-optimal with respect to content (it's at least
as good as the current guide, and better in at least one place).  Thus
my advice, should you choose to take it, is that we should merge this
patch to get these docs in-tree, and make improvements as additional
patches that can focus on particular API calls rather than try to get
everything perfect on this patch.

Change-Id: I51dfaf1832108466f115ab183838c5f28e138312

subject: Add configuration options for DISK_WAIT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 22:38:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/41230adc37a1cbda5420916b4f3dd57d24f66706', 'message': '[WIP] Add configuration options for DISK_WAIT

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320295/ introduced two internal
variables: _DISK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS and _DISK_WAIT_DELAY. These values are
hardcoded. This patch adds configuration options for these so
that an operator can change them based on their own needs/fleet of
hardware.

Change-Id: I2ba97669ec710fb4a435307466cd8add9c2293ba
Closes-Bug: #1585663
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-07 22:15:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/d3f5fc5fce1180b77fbe3a6d71f7c47aaad490de', 'message': '[WIP] Add configuration options for DISK_WAIT

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320295/ introduced two internal
variables: _DISK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS and _DISK_WAIT_DELAY. These values are
hardcoded. This patch adds configuration options for these so
that an operator can change them based on their own needs/fleet of
hardware.

commit_message:
Add configuration options for DISK_WAIT

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320295/ introduced two internal
variables: _DISK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS and _DISK_WAIT_DELAY. These values are
hardcoded. This patch adds configuration options for these so
that an operator can change them based on their own needs/fleet of
hardware.

Change-Id: I2ba97669ec710fb4a435307466cd8add9c2293ba
Closes-Bug: #1585663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/09/324909/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('disk_wait_attempts', default=APARAMS.get('ipa-disk-wait-attempts', 10), help='The number of times to try and check to see if ' 'at least one suitable disk has appeared in inventory ' 'before proceeding with any actions.'), cfg.IntOpt('disk_wait_delay', default=APARAMS.get('ipa-disk-wait-delay', 3), help='How much time (in seconds) to wait between attempts ' 'to check if at least one suitable disk has appeared ' 'in inventory.'),

commit_message:
Rewrite deepModel code to a mixin

    replacing not supported Backbone.DeepModel v0.10.4
    https://github.com/powmedia/backbone-deep-model with mixin
    modified to use ES2015 features and Lodash 4.x methods

Change-Id: I7b7c9be955e00d5cabf35441bad5d66c5ada537a

commit_message:
Service client modules in identity __init__

Import the identity service client classes in the __init__ of the
identity modules in v2 and v3, and define __all__, so that service
client classes may be accessed by importing the identity module only.

Change-Id: I9ea4c30a0abbdfc4532d074fd073c2666c7eb84f

subject: Make `tempest init` working dir an abspath
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 15:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/init.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9346483d38d9921f222d24132eb8220ecd9def34', 'message': 'Make `tempest init` working dir an abspath

The working directory can be either a relative path or absolute path
depending on how `tempest init` is called. If `tempest init` is called,
the working directory is absolute, but if `tempest init [dir]` is
called, the working directory is relative. The relative case leads to a
bug in setting up the tempest config file later.

We normalized and absolutized local_dir early on, and make everything
work with abspath. This minimize handling of the different paths and
reduces the chances of bugs from handling in later code.

Change-Id: I6dc314017eb264302ba68bbf25060e833d8e317a
Closes-Bug: #1593747
'}]
commit_message:
Make `tempest init` working dir an abspath

The working directory can be either a relative path or absolute path
depending on how `tempest init` is called. If `tempest init` is called,
the working directory is absolute, but if `tempest init [dir]` is
called, the working directory is relative. The relative case leads to a
bug in setting up the tempest config file later.

We normalized and absolutized local_dir early on, and make everything
work with abspath. This minimize handling of the different paths and
reduces the chances of bugs from handling in later code.

Change-Id: I6dc314017eb264302ba68bbf25060e833d8e317a
Closes-Bug: #1593747
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/331218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # make sure we are working with abspath however tempest init is called local_dir = os.path.abspath(local_dir)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 15:40:11.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/2e3726e8915e93c87d4544911c33134956a064ed', 'message': 'cfg: deprecate ListOpt

This patch deprecates ListOpt and mark it for removal. ListOpt is mostly used
for multi valued options. Unfortunately, it separate options using "," in their
definition string, which is less reliable than using MultiOpt which on the
opposite:

1. is more reliable by using a line for each value rather than spliting a
   string on ","
2. is easier to use as a CLI option (native  argparse support)

Change-Id: Iee64cb8919a1c29c18dcdc132d7d98d9c28c4421
'}]
commit_message:
cfg: deprecate ListOpt

This patch deprecates ListOpt and mark it for removal. ListOpt is mostly used
for multi valued options. Unfortunately, it separate options using "," in their
definition string, which is less reliable than using MultiOpt which on the
opposite:

1. is more reliable by using a line for each value rather than spliting a
   string on ","
2. is easier to use as a CLI option (native  argparse support)

This should improve the overall configuration user experience.

Closes-Bug: #1587315
Change-Id: Iee64cb8919a1c29c18dcdc132d7d98d9c28c4421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/54/323454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @removals.remove(version='3.11', removal_version='4.0') This class is deprecated since oslo.config 3.11 and should be removed in 4.0. Use MultiOpt or MultiStrOpt instead.

commit_message:
SortBy for Hibernate ORM

Commits implements sortBy functionality in ORM
for:
- Alarm repository
- AlarmDefinition repository

Change-Id: I4c9141cfd313d457481cf2ab3b5d3db319043210
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/39/325839/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: private static final String STATE = "STATE"; private static final String FIND_ALARM_DEF_SQL = "SELECT t.id, t.tenant_id, t.name, " + "t.description, t.expression, t.severity, t.match_by, " + "t.actions_enabled, aa.alarm_state AS state, aa.action_id AS notificationIds " + "FROM (SELECT distinct ad.id, ad.tenant_id, ad.name, ad.description, ad.expression, " + "ad.severity, ad.match_by, ad.actions_enabled, ad.created_at, ad.updated_at, ad.deleted_at " + "FROM alarm_definition AS ad LEFT OUTER JOIN sub_alarm_definition AS sad ON ad.id = sad.alarm_definition_id " + "LEFT OUTER JOIN sub_alarm_definition_dimension AS dim ON sad.id = dim.sub_alarm_definition_id %1$s " + "WHERE ad.tenant_id = :tenantId AND ad.deleted_at IS NULL %2$s ORDER BY ad.id %3$s) AS t " + "LEFT OUTER JOIN alarm_action AS aa ON t.id = aa.alarm_definition_id %4$s"; final StringBuilder sbWhere = new StringBuilder(); final StringBuilder limitOffset = new StringBuilder(); final StringBuilder orderByPart = new StringBuilder(); if (sortBy != null && !sortBy.isEmpty()) { orderByPart.append(" order by ").append(COMMA_JOINER.join(sortBy)); if (!sortBy.contains("id")) { orderByPart.append(",id"); } } else { orderByPart.append(" order by id "); } final String sql = String.format( FIND_ALARM_DEF_SQL, SubAlarmDefinitionQueries.buildJoinClauseFor(dimensions), sbWhere, limitOffset, orderByPart );
deleted_lines: import monasca.api.resource.exception.Exceptions; private static final String STATE = "STATES"; if (sortBy != null && !sortBy.isEmpty()) { throw Exceptions.unprocessableEntity( "Sort_by is not implemented for the hibernate database type"); } // TODO introduce criteria here, will make code significantly better String query = " SELECT t.id, t.tenant_id, t.name, t.description, t.expression, t.severity, t.match_by, " + "t.actions_enabled, aa.alarm_state AS states, aa.action_id AS notificationIds " + "FROM (SELECT distinct ad.id, ad.tenant_id, ad.name, ad.description, ad.expression, " + "ad.severity, ad.match_by, ad.actions_enabled, ad.created_at, ad.updated_at, ad.deleted_at " + "FROM alarm_definition AS ad LEFT OUTER JOIN sub_alarm_definition AS sad ON ad.id = sad.alarm_definition_id " + "LEFT OUTER JOIN sub_alarm_definition_dimension AS dim ON sad.id = dim.sub_alarm_definition_id %1$s " + "WHERE ad.tenant_id = :tenantId AND ad.deleted_at IS NULL %2$s ORDER BY ad.id %3$s) AS t " + "LEFT OUTER JOIN alarm_action AS aa ON t.id = aa.alarm_definition_id ORDER BY t.id, t.created_at"; StringBuilder sbWhere = new StringBuilder(); StringBuilder limitOffset = new StringBuilder(); String sql = String.format(query, SubAlarmDefinitionQueries.buildJoinClauseFor(dimensions), sbWhere, limitOffset);

commit_message:
Validate node id for log handler

This change updates the log handler to validate that the node id being
passed in is an integer. If it is not an integer, the response will be a
400.

Change-Id: Ida7a18a7261bf7fa98518a059d1de42690382d79
Closes-Bug: #1585160
(cherry picked from commit 6e5c7474ae1378b3cbd6cc45d0b973a1101cdf83)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 16:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/9e8834489e6caec1b7e640ae56d2fbf4bf2e3775', 'message': "Disable rabbitmq cluster partition handling

Currently autoheal functionality is a subset of OCF script
functionality (autoheal is concerned only with network partitions, OCF

both of this functions cause stopping and starting of rabbits, it
results in unwanted interference - as we've observed in 1585128, where

Change-Id: I38fbf6d50e9aed35f3c5e3bc1e17de7001304706
Closes-Bug: 1585128

commit_message:
Disable rabbitmq cluster partition handling

Currently autoheal functionality is a subset of OCF script
functionality (autoheal is concerned only with network partitions, OCF
also handles all sort of cases where rabbitmq becomes stuck). But as
both of this functions cause stopping and starting of rabbits, it
results in unwanted interference - as we've observed in 1585128, where
it triggered bug in autoheal code.

Even if rabbitmq bug will be fixed, it makes no sense to use both
autoheal and OCF script (actually, when clustered rabbit will stop
getting stuck during network split, autoheal will be as good as OCF
script).

Change-Id: I38fbf6d50e9aed35f3c5e3bc1e17de7001304706
Closes-Bug: 1585128
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/69/322269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $cluster_partition_handling = hiera('rabbit_cluster_partition_handling', 'ignore')

commit_message:
Be consistent about context first argument in db api

By ensuring every db api function has the context as its first
argument, this raises the possiblity of using oslo.db recommended
session handling:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.db/usage.html#session-handling

Change-Id: I3649bdbf254e2834e79984cc381a1db1ea9e78b8
Related-Bug: #1479723

commit_message:
Remove incorrectly used "# flake8: noqa"

"# flake8: noqa" option disables all checks for the whole file.
To disable one line we should use "# noqa".
Remove unused "# flake8: noqa" and fix hidden hacking errors.

Closes Bug: #1540254

Change-Id: I5c7f2f95038e0a26d1ebfb6a64aaae31b80ed5cc

commit_message:
Make astute log level configurable

This change updates the astute configuration to honor the fuel debug
setting for determining when to enable debug logging for astute.

Change-Id: I0bd6940bf7e730a529b23975a11fed208dab14d4
Closes-Bug: #1588412

commit_message:
use utf8 as default charset for all tables in mysql db

When we use "cinder-manager db sync" to create tables in mysql db,
some tables' charset is set to utf8 but some not. This will cause
db error when a foreign key is referenced to column in different
charset. This change set all tables in cinder use utf8 as default
charset.

Closes-bug: #1594195

Change-Id: I15a864dd1ad18aa1b3e3ff7fe511405d62a119cc

commit_message:
Fix css class for cancel button on metadata modal

The cancel button should have css class "cancel" to be consistent with the other
cancel buttons across the UI.

Change-Id: Iee4e3336382c3a61dc722e1c3a2d824366ce7602
Closes-bug: #1593886

added_lines: <button class="btn btn-default cancel" ng-click="modal.cancel()">

added_lines: hasChangesInRemainingNodes() { var {initialDisks} = this.state; return _.some(this.props.nodes.slice(1), (node) => { var disksData = node.disks.toJSON(); return _.some( models.Disk.prototype.editableAttributes, (diskProperty) => { return !_.isEqual(_.map(disksData, diskProperty), _.map(initialDisks, diskProperty)); } ); }); }, ) || this.props.nodes.length > 1 && this.hasChangesInRemainingNodes();

subject: Do not print unhandled exception if in production
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 09:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/c61fbc616fc6763c358ad70dac37341f65ddcb19', 'message': 'Do not print unhandled exception if in production

This change removes the printing of unhandled exceptions when not in
development mode. We should never return the unhandled exception
information when not in development mode.

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160
(cherry picked from commit f121a0c3225b86e59c347c57b9a1c5383dc8127e)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not print unhandled exception if in production

This change removes the printing of unhandled exceptions when not in
development mode. We should never return the unhandled exception
information when not in development mode.

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160
(cherry picked from commit f121a0c3225b86e59c347c57b9a1c5383dc8127e)

added_lines: if "hosts" in filters: select = select.where(cn_tbl.c.host.in_(filters["hosts"]))@pick_context_manager_reader_allow_async def compute_node_get_all_by_hosts(context, hosts): results = _compute_node_fetchall(context, {"hosts": hosts}) if not results: raise exception.ComputeHostNotFound(host=hosts) return results

subject: Skip network allocation if 'none' is requested
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-23 02:49:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/84bea89a5c194a6369173e658e977544a8f48173', 'message': "WIP: Skip network allocation if 'none' is requested

If we're explicitly told to not allocate networks, then
don't, skip network allocation.

This also skips network deallocation if we can tell that
we wouldn't have allocated networks because 'none' was
requested for networking. Note, however, that this is just
an optimization when requested_networks is available - which
is not the case with a local delete from the compute API.
Even if we didn't check in the deallocate case it would be fine
since deallocate_for_instance in nova-network and neutron
network APIs won't find any resources to delete since none
were allocated to begin with. But at least we can try to save
ourselves some RPC/DB (nova-network) and REST API (neutron)
traffic.

Part of blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: Ia0d5189453df825805dab028cc81de7dfa0d6c84

we wouldn't have allocated networks because 'none' was
requested for networking. Note, however, that this is just
an optimization when requested_networks is available - which
is not the case with a local delete from the compute API.
Even if we didn't check in the deallocate case it would be fine

network APIs won't find any resources to delete since none
