commit_message:
Skip network allocation if 'none' is requested

If we're explicitly told to not allocate networks, then
don't, skip network allocation.

This also skips network deallocation if we can tell that
we wouldn't have allocated networks because 'none' was
requested for networking. Note, however, that this is just
an optimization when requested_networks is available - which
is not the case with a local delete from the compute API.
Even if we didn't check in the deallocate case it would be fine
since deallocate_for_instance in nova-network and neutron
network APIs won't find any resources to delete since none
were allocated to begin with. But at least we can try to save
ourselves some RPC/DB (nova-network) and REST API (neutron)
traffic.

Part of blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: Ia0d5189453df825805dab028cc81de7dfa0d6c84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/309638/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # First check to see if we're specifically not supposed to allocate # networks because if so, we can exit early. if requested_networks and requested_networks.no_allocate: LOG.debug("Not allocating networking since 'none' was specified.", instance=instance) return network_model.NetworkInfo([]) # If we were told not to allocate networks let's save ourselves # the trouble of calling the network API. if requested_networks and requested_networks.no_allocate: LOG.debug("Skipping network deallocation for instance since " "networking was not requested.", instance=instance) return

commit_message:
processutils: add support for missing process limits

The original commit adding support for process limits only wired
up address space, max files and resident set size limits. This
is not sufficient to enable nova to protect qemu-img commands
against malicious images.

This commit adds support for the remaining limits supported
by python: core file size, cpu time, data size, file size,
locked memory size, max processes and stack size.

Related-bug: #1449062
Change-Id: I164c4b35e1357a0f80ed7fe00a7ae8f49df92e31
(cherry picked from commit 8af826953d1ad2cab2ecf360e0c794de70a367c3)
(cherry picked from commit 5f417f8e9656e097070036daced26d8b0f3728c3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/22/332222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if soft_limit <= 0: def test_core_size(self): size = self.soft_limit(resource.RLIMIT_CORE, 1, 1024) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(core_file_size=size) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_CORE', prlimit.core_file_size) def test_cpu_time(self): time = self.soft_limit(resource.RLIMIT_CPU, 1, 1024) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(cpu_time=time) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_CPU', prlimit.cpu_time) def test_data_size(self): max_memory = self.memory_limit(resource.RLIMIT_DATA) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(data_size=max_memory) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_DATA', max_memory) def test_file_size(self): size = self.soft_limit(resource.RLIMIT_FSIZE, 1, 1024) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(file_size=size) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_FSIZE', prlimit.file_size) def test_memory_locked(self): max_memory = self.memory_limit(resource.RLIMIT_MEMLOCK) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(memory_locked=max_memory) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_MEMLOCK', max_memory) def test_number_processes(self): nprocs = self.soft_limit(resource.RLIMIT_NPROC, 1, 65535) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(number_processes=nprocs) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_NPROC', nprocs) def test_stack_size(self): max_memory = self.memory_limit(resource.RLIMIT_STACK) prlimit = processutils.ProcessLimits(stack_size=max_memory) self.check_limit(prlimit, 'RLIMIT_STACK', max_memory)

commit_message:
Make registering error handlers compliant with Flask 0.11

With Flask 0.11 setting error handlers by directly modifying
app.error_handler_spec dictionary leads to AttributeErrors.
It should be done by using register_error_handler method or
errorhandler decorator.

Change-Id: I2f41ab2b9ea8c4a964b16acdf77def1b08b64a6e
Closes-Bug: #1587849
(cherry picked from commit 685f7c17fd5c882e1b7198507112c2ebb8fce745)

commit_message:
Fix variable reference error in tempest run cmd

If '.testrepository' dir exist in path then tempest run
throw error -  local variable 'returncode' referenced before assignment

Making the if condition which causing this in right indentation and defining
the variable in starting also.

Partially-implements: bp tempest-run-cmd

Change-Id: I84d759caa670330f39eafdb26a4fffc82578709a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/87/332687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: returncode = 0 if returncode: sys.exit(returncode)

commit_message:
Add support to the history import tools for release-type

When trying to use the history import tools we need to use the correct
release-type setting to validate tags.

We can't use versionutils.validate_version() as it's a generator which is
hard to use in a sorted() function.  Insetad introduce
versionutils.canonical_version() which will return the version is valid
or raise a ValueError() exception.

Change-Id: If10aab4c573342227e2909fd84f843c96f3abc43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/43/330843/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_releases.versionutils import canonical_versionparser.add_argument('--release-type', dest='release_type', default='std', help=('Which release-type to use for this deliverable' '(Default: %(default)s)')) f.write('release-type: %s\n' % args.release_type) milestones_sorted = \ sorted(milestones.items(), key=lambda x: canonical_version(x[0], args.release_type))
deleted_lines: from distutils.version import StrictVersion milestones_sorted = sorted(milestones.items(), key=lambda x: StrictVersion(x[0]))

commit_message:
Add Support for validating 4 digit verion strings

The xstatic packages have a 4 digit verion number 3-digit semver as
supplied by upstream and a local build number.  PBR only supports 3
digit semver.

To work with that create the concpet of a release type that can have
slightly different validation rules.  In this case use the 'packaging'
library.

This will allow the horizon team to use the standard release process.

For refernce see:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/xstatic-release-process

Change-Id: Ie0f33097c31ee4006ec58147b35731913f7b6f4b

commit_message:
Tests: Use mock for notifier tests

Rather than having a fake_notifier which stores notifications,
just mock notify calls and ensure that the expected calls
are made.

The previous method of doing this was fundamentally flawed
and racy -- this should fix up the reoccuring issues with
notifications tests failures.

Closes-Bug: #1582306

Change-Id: Ied505362889d402a296fdfd65db758668f2a4d65

commit_message:
Fix non-uniqueness error message for image

Glance common api exceptions do not have standard message
defined in some cases like NoUniqueMatch. We should pass
a custom message, when throwing that exception.

Change-Id: Icc579cceac3f2d24fed0c8284bdf9ec7f9f338eb
Closes-Bug: #1590727

commit_message:
Repair fuelweb_admin network metadata

When upgrade from version 6.0 to 8.0, the fuelweb_admin network metadata
is restored from version 6.0. However, since version 6.1, certain params
in the metadata changed, which is reflected in fixture/admin_network.json
file.

Set 'gateway' field for network group 'fuelweb_admin' to the address
of the Fuel Master node.

Set 'vip_type' field in ip_addrs table for the 'fuelweb_admin' to NULL.

Change-Id: Ice94dcb7826b5357b9aaab56ea1632d77160db5e
Partial-bug: 1573075

subject: Remove Packaging-Deb project team
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-14 13:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/retired-projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/1e5a94ca4ccfa76f5cf557af66b40acb51ecaf7f', 'message': 'Remove Packaging-Deb project team

The Packaging-Deb team was added August 13, 2015. Since that date
we added a requirement for minimum activity (following the rejection
of the Kosmos team), so it seems fair (after a decent grace period)
to revisit previously-approved official project teams based on that
new requirement.

The Packaging-Deb team specifies 25 repositories, of which only
one was created. That repository has two boilerplate commits[1].
Progress is not being discussed on the ML or in regular IRC
meetings. As far as OpenStack is concerned, this team basically
hasn't started yet.

When the issue was raised at the last PTL elections, Thomas Goirand
(the original team creator and main contributor) justified the
team existence in a ML thread[2]. In particular, the team is
actually active, but on alioth.debian.org git repositories.

While the team may be active, it is not an OpenStack project team,
it is a Debian project team, and all the visible work currently
happens there (on Debian git repositories and IRC channels). So I
don't think that should count toward "activity" for the OpenStack
official project team we are considering.

Thomas also said that progress is being stalled on getting a Debian
image supported in OpenStack Infrastructure, an objective that has
been lacking the necessary manpower or priority to be completed
until now. Being punted back to unofficial status would undo the
last 10 months efforts.

While this might have been true one year ago, we now no longer
undo anything when a project team is made unofficial, the git
repositories can stay up under the same name, and infrastructure
bits can be configured the same. So making the unborn project
"unofficial" does not undo any work that's been done, it only
reflects the actual status of the project team.

When the team starts working on the OpenStack side and the
repositories see some activity, I'll be more than happy to
reconsider adding this team. But for the time being we need
to remove it, if only to be fair with other nascent new teams
that we reject based on lack of past activity.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/deb-openstack-pkg-tools/log/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089369.html

Change-Id: If51c21cfc1e918a18921b5399b55e7805a1f9eea
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Packaging-Deb project team

The Packaging-Deb team was added August 13, 2015. Since that date
we added a requirement for minimum activity (following the rejection
of the Kosmos team), so it seems fair (after a decent grace period)
to revisit previously-approved official project teams based on that
new requirement.

The Packaging-Deb team specifies 25 repositories, of which only
one was created. That repository has two boilerplate commits[1].
Progress is not being discussed on the ML or in regular IRC
meetings. As far as OpenStack is concerned, this team basically
hasn't started yet.

When the issue was raised at the last PTL elections, Thomas Goirand
(the original team creator and main contributor) justified the
team existence in a ML thread[2]. In particular, the team is
actually active, but on alioth.debian.org git repositories.

While the team may be active, it is not an OpenStack project team,
it is a Debian project team, and all the visible work currently
happens there (on Debian git repositories and IRC channels). So I
don't think that should count toward "activity" for the OpenStack
official project team we are considering.

Thomas also said that progress is being stalled on getting a Debian
image supported in OpenStack Infrastructure, an objective that has
been lacking the necessary manpower or priority to be completed
until now. Being punted back to unofficial status would undo the
last 10 months efforts.

While this might have been true one year ago, we now no longer
undo anything when a project team is made unofficial, the git
repositories can stay up under the same name, and infrastructure
bits can be configured the same. So making the unborn project
"unofficial" does not undo any work that's been done, it only
reflects the actual status of the project team.

When the team starts working on the OpenStack side and the
repositories see some activity, I'll be more than happy to
reconsider adding this team. But for the time being we need
to remove it, if only to be fair with other nascent new teams
that we reject based on lack of past activity.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/deb-openstack-pkg-tools/log/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089369.html

commit_message:
Define v1 image_members_client as library

Image v1 API's image_members_client has good interfaces now,
then this patch makes the client as a library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I51af23c1249a10c8d4ddea99b28e61dccb5f38c2

commit_message:
Delete service_token from keystone on Fuel Master

Deletes keystone service token after deploying keystone to
minimize security risk.

Adapted from Change-ID I776644f727ce086369954f383a09b48b60bf11a5

Change-Id: Id57f11407d58230b68d05ea3beada833e65f9370

commit_message:
Update default network settings only for available releases

After upgrade it's possible to manage older releases but not to deploy fresh
clusters. Since there is no TUN segmentation type in older releases we can
get KeyError.

Change-Id: I9b22f7fc9b4eac8f1418cd6da81b39df9efaa86f
Closes-bug:1594447

commit_message:
Delete old images after restoring

Remove exists images after restore call because
they are contains old ssh keys and can't be used
anymore.

Change-Id: Ib8887621d2fef69c2ee00ebad486415a9be476d3

DOC - Adopting the common role documentation pattern

As discussed during the Newton design summit, we
agreed to adopt the role documentation pattern laid
out in the os_keystone role

Change-Id: I43a21c3f9fe8dbf50f0f16c2c172c1aeff2fc173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client refs/changes/16/331716/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ansible role to deploy rsyslog for client use. This role will ship any and all logs discovered in the ``rsyslog_client_log_dir`` directory to any valid rsyslog target. The role was designed to be used by OpenStack-Ansible by leveraging multiple logging hosts via the **rsyslog_all** group. If that inventory group is not defined additional log shipping targets can be defined using ``rsyslog_client_user_defined_targets`` Default Variables ================= .. literalinclude:: ../../defaults/main.yml :language: yaml :start-after: under the License. Required Variables ================== None Example Playbook ================ - role: "rsyslog_client" rsyslog_client_log_rotate_file: test_log_rotate rsyslog_client_log_dir: "/var/log" rsyslog_client_config_name: "99-test-rsyslog-client.conf" rsyslog_client_log_files: - /var/log/dmesg - /var/log/udev
deleted_lines: :tags: openstack, rsyslog, server, cloud, ansible :category: \*nix Role to deploy rsyslog for use within OpenStack. - { role: "rsyslog_client", tags: [ "rsyslog-client" ] }

commit_message:
Add not live migration case in upgrade node

with argument --no-live-migration you may start command
upgrade-node and upgrade more than 1 compute and more than 1 ceph-osd in
one command

Usage:

    octane upgrade-node --no-live-migration $SEED_ID <ID> <ID> <ID>

Change-Id: I77fc7404131ebc8d30cf53a39c63e48c00481188
(cherry picked from commit 40956ee786e08cac5ededb05f5bf3d2fb127236a)

commit_message:
Validate nodes roles to exclude upgrade of single controller

The proper sequence to upgrade controllers is:

- upgrade primary controller in isolation
- cut over to the new control plane
- upgrade remaining controllers at once

To exclude the possibility to upgrade single controller after
the cutover, add validation of roles of nodes to upgrade and
stop if the only node passed to the script is a CIC.

Change-Id: Ie91ae35acb7e36103004a59c92cb495837e0dca0
Closes-bug: 1584656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/99/321599/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport

+

Recently, oslo.messaging does a refactor [1] which causes

commit_message:
Remove oslo_utils.timeutils.total_seconds() usage + catch DriverLoadFailure for get_transport optional + fix CI failure due to oslo.messaging 5.0.0 + correct concurrency of gabbi

This function was deprecated and has been removed.

+

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport
driver, hence breaks our code and unit test as well.

This patch fixes it by adding DriverLoadFailure to catch list.

Closes-Bug: #1588151
(cherry picked from commit d7f8ce94e433da8af3660ecf52715a04c221fde5)

+

Recently, oslo.messaging does a refactor [1] which causes
get_batch_notification_listener returns a new type
BatchNotificationServer instead of previous MessageHandlingServer,
they have different attributes, so our test code which relies on
MessageHandlingServer fails in CI gate.

This patch makes test code not rely on oslo.messaging details.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/990d894eaf0d18941b56d89bff2bca51de375640

(cherry picked from commit 23d5c9f648d8352aa205fbe46ba9796a5424874f)

+

Correct concurrency of gabbi tests for gabbi 1.22.0

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 8fcbc8de4ea878bdec1ef8754eaf965e176854b3)

Change-Id: I02b5d1b3f4a9169cbf428a5eff9c6705494741af

commit_message:
Delete service_token from keystone on Fuel Master

Deletes keystone service token after deploying keystone to
minimize security risk.

Adapted from Change-ID I776644f727ce086369954f383a09b48b60bf11a5

Change-Id: Ie08121bdc3cdaa682201831f1253edd0b2659261
Closes-Bug: #1582893
(cherry picked from commit 818007fb41b9503e658f84d7f6b7b7a126be9b59)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/67/329367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $fuel_settings = parseyaml($astute_settings_yaml) if is_hash($::fuel_version) and $::fuel_version['VERSION'] and $::fuel_version['VERSION']['production'] { $production = $::fuel_version['VERSION']['production'] } else { $production = 'prod' } if $production != "docker-build" { $keystone_service_token_off = true if $keystone_service_token_off { include ::keystone::params keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/admin_token': ensure => absent; } # Get paste.ini source $keystone_paste_ini = $::keystone::params::paste_config ? { undef => '/etc/keystone/keystone-paste.ini', default => $::keystone::params::paste_config, } # Remove admin_token_auth middleware from public/admin/v3 pipelines exec { 'remove_admin_token_auth_middleware': path => ['/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => "sed -i.dist 's/ admin_token_auth//' ${keystone_paste_ini}", onlyif => "fgrep -q ' admin_token_auth' ${keystone_paste_ini}", } service { 'keystone': ensure => 'running', name => $::keystone::params::service_name, enable => true, } # Restart service so that changes take effect Keystone_config<||> ~> Service['keystone'] Exec['remove_admin_token_auth_middleware'] ~> Service['keystone'] } }

commit_message:
[contributor] Update guideline of RST reference

Sphinx allows separate reference definition, but it is not translator
friendly because translators cannot control links (for example,
they may want to use links to translated documents), so we recommend
not to use separate reference definitions.

This convention is already applied in reviews but not documented so far.

References:
ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-November/007955.html
Networking guide changes: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301265/

Change-Id: I0ed77e57f3442d962deed3fca01e7a4a7c11ab04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/331484/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Recommend not to use separate link definitions. It prevents translated documents from using different links (for example, corresponding links to translated versions). NOTE: This way is not recommended.
deleted_lines: * If a source file contains a big number of external references, you can separate a link from its definition for better readability while reviewing as shown in the example.

commit_message:
Update l2/port.pp vlan interface name regexp.

Previously only interfaces with aaaNNN.XXX were recognized as vlan
subinterfaces where NNN and XXX are digits and NNN is required.
It doesn't allow to create vlan subinterfaces with names like
aaa-bbb.XXX.
This patch updates regexp to recognize names like:
aaaNNN.XXX aaa-bbb.XXX aaa.XXX aaa-bbb-NNN.XXX

Closes-Bug: #1593142
Change-Id: Ic3d97cf5f32cb1107c185fc9ce6c980303e0fc92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/90/329290/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: /^([\w\-]+\d+)\.(\d+)/: { if $vlan_dev == false { # special case for non-vlan devices witn naming like "aaaNNN.XXX"

commit_message:
Show 'deletion_time' for stack-list/stack-show apis

We support to get the deleted stacks by filter in stack-list
api, support to show the deleted stack by stack-id,
so to show the 'deletion_time' info of stacks.

Change-Id: I8c55fe7f6a899ca66aa3fef15c93195c03c5aa11
Closes-Bug: #1587214

subject: Do a single query to fetch all event_list stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 04:20:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/1e9349d3e3d9733e2f66ce019b3ab07aefa703c8', 'message': 'Do a single query to fetch all event_list stacks

commit_message:
Do a single query to fetch all event_list stacks

In preperation for supporting event list --nested-depth, do a single
query to fetch the stacks that correspond to the event list.

Related-Bug: #1588561

Change-Id: I106c21bbb87b9a591f3aba7de03eb130e7fd7b19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/35/325035/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stack_identifiers = {} stack_identifiers[st.id] = st.identifier() events = list(event_object.Event.get_all_by_stack( filters=filters)) else: events = list(event_object.Event.get_all_by_tenant( filters=filters)) stack_ids = {e.stack_id for e in events} if len(stack_identifiers) != len(stack_ids): for s in stack_object.Stack.get_all(cnxt, filters={'id': stack_ids}, show_nested=True): stack_identifiers[s.id] = s.identifier() return [api.format_event(e, stack_identifiers.get(e.stack_id))
deleted_lines: stacks = {} stacks[st.id] = st events = event_object.Event.get_all_by_stack( filters=filters) else: events = event_object.Event.get_all_by_tenant( filters=filters) def get_stack_identifier(stack_id): if stack_id not in stacks: s = stack_object.Stack.get_by_id( cnxt, stack_id, show_deleted=True) if not s: return stacks[stack_id] = s return stacks[stack_id].identifier() return [api.format_event(e, get_stack_identifier(e.stack_id))

added_lines:
# Cedric Savignan <liced@liced.fr>, 2016. #zanata"POT-Creation-Date: 2016-06-21 09:08+0000
""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-06-21 03:52+0000
" "Last-Translator: Cedric Savignan <liced@liced.fr>
"msgid "**Debian:** https://wiki.debian.org/OpenStack" msgstr "**Debian:** https://wiki.debian.org/OpenStack" msgid "**Ubuntu:** https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ServerTeam/CloudArchive" msgstr "**Ubuntu:** https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ServerTeam/CloudArchive" msgid "" "**openSUSE and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server:** https://en.opensuse.org/" "Portal:OpenStack" msgstr "" "**openSUSE and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server:** https://en.opensuse.org/" "Portal:OpenStack" "A great way to get answers and insights is to post your question or " "problematic scenario to the OpenStack mailing list. You can learn from and " "help others who might have similar issues. To subscribe or view the " "archives, go to http://lists.openstack.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/" "openstack. If you are interested in the other mailing lists for specific " "projects or development, refer to `Mailing Lists <https://wiki.openstack.org/" "wiki/Mailing_Lists>`__." msgstr "" "Un excellent moyen d'obtenir des réponses ou des idées est de poster votre " "question ou problématique à la liste de diffusion OpenStack. Vous pouvez " "apprendre et aider d'autres personnes qui pourraient avoir des problèmes " "similaires. Pour vous abonner ou voir les archives, consulter http://lists." "openstack.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/openstack. Si vous êtes intéressé " "par d'autres listes de diffusion pour des projets spécifiques ou du " "développement, se référer à `Mailing Lists <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/" "Mailing_Lists>`__." msgid ""msgid "" "Any deployment-specific information is helpful, such as whether you are " "using Ubuntu 14.04 or are performing a multi-node installation." msgstr "" "Toute information spécifique au développement est utile, comme le fait que " "vous utilisiez Ubuntu 14.04 or si vous procédez à une installation multi-" "nodes." msgid "" "Be sure to include the software and package versions that you are using, " "especially if you are using a development branch, such as, ``"Kilo release" "" vs git commit bc79c3ecc55929bac585d04a03475b72e06a3208``." msgstr "" "N'oubliez pas d'inclure les versions de logiciels et de package que vous " "utilisez, surtout dans le cas où vous avez une branche de développement " "comme ``"Kilo release" vs git commit " "bc79c3ecc55929bac585d04a03475b72e06a3208``." msgid "Conventions" msgstr "Conventions" msgid "" "During the set up or testing of OpenStack, you might have questions about " "how a specific task is completed or be in a situation where a feature does " "not work correctly. Use the `ask.openstack.org <https://ask.openstack." "org>`__ site to ask questions and get answers. When you visit the https://" "ask.openstack.org site, scan the recently asked questions to see whether " "your question has already been answered. If not, ask a new question. Be sure " "to give a clear, concise summary in the title and provide as much detail as " "possible in the description. Paste in your command output or stack traces, " "links to screen shots, and any other information which might be useful." msgstr "" "Pendant l'installation ou l'essai d'OpenStack, vous pourriez avoir des " "questions sur la façon dont une tâche spécifique doit être complétée ou vous " "pourriez vous trouver dans une situation où une fonctionnalité ne fonctionne " "pas correctement. Utiliser le site ask.openstack.org <https://ask.openstack." "org>`__ pour poser des questions et obtenir des réponses. Lorsque vous " "visitez le site https://ask.openstack.org, regardez les questions récemment " "posées pour voir si on a déjà répondu à votre question. Si ce n'est pas le " "cas, posez-la. N'oubliez pas de donner un résumé clair et succinct dans " "l'intitulé et de fournir autant de détails que possible dans la description. " "Collez votre sortie de commande ou les traces de la pile, les liens de " "captures d'écran et toute autre information qui pourrait être utile." msgid "Give a clear, concise summary." msgstr "Faîtes un récapitulatif clair et succinct." msgid "Notices" msgstr "Notifications" msgid "Notices take these forms:" msgstr "Les notifications prennent les formes suivantes :" msgid "OpenStack distribution packages" msgstr "Packages de distribution d'Openstack" msgid "" "Provide as much detail as possible in the description. Paste in your command " "output or stack traces, links to screen shots, and any other information " "which might be useful." msgstr "" "Donner le plus de détails possibles dans la description. Coller votre sortie " "de commande ou les traces de pile, des liens vers des captures d'écran, ou " "toute autre information qui puisse être utile." #, fuzzy msgid "" "The OpenStack community lives in the #openstack IRC channel on the Freenode " "network. You can hang out, ask questions, or get immediate feedback for " "urgent and pressing issues. To install an IRC client or use a browser-based " "client, go to `https://webchat.freenode.net/ <https://webchat.freenode." "net>`__. You can also use Colloquy (Mac OS X, http://colloquy.info/), mIRC " "(Windows, http://www.mirc.com/), or XChat (Linux). When you are in the IRC " "channel and want to share code or command output, the generally accepted " "method is to use a Paste Bin. The OpenStack project has one at http://paste." "openstack.org. Just paste your longer amounts of text or logs in the web " "form and you get a URL that you can paste into the channel. The OpenStack " "IRC channel is ``#openstack`` on ``irc.freenode.net``. You can find a list " "of all OpenStack IRC channels at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC." msgstr "" "La communauté OpenStack communique sur le canal IRC #openstack du réseau " "Freenode. Vous pouvez y enregistrer votre présence, poser des questions ou " "obtenir des informations immédiates au sujet de problèmes urgents ou " "pressants. Pour installer un client IRC ou utiliser un client basé " "navigateur, allez à 'https://webchat.freenode.net/ <https://webchat.freenode." "net>`__. Vous pouvez également utiliser XChat (Linux), mIRC (Windows, http://" "www.mirc.com/) ou Colloquy (MacOSX, http://colloquy.info/). Lorsque vous " "êtes sur le canal IRC et que vous souhaitez partager du code ou le résultat " "d'une commande, la méthode généralement acceptée est d'utiliser une Paste " "Bin. Le projet OpenStack en possède une http://paste.openstack.org. Il " "suffit de coller votre texte ou logs dans le formulaire web et vous " "obtiendrez une URL à coller dans le canal. Le canal IRC OpenStack est '' " "#openstack'' sur '' irc.freenode.net. ''. Vous trouverez une liste de tous " "les canaux IRC OpenStack à l'adresse suivante : https://wiki.openstack.org/" "wiki/IRC." msgid "" "The OpenStack community values your set up and testing efforts and wants " "your feedback. To log a bug, you must sign up for a Launchpad account at " "https://launchpad.net/+login. You can view existing bugs and report bugs in " "the Launchpad Bugs area. Use the search feature to determine whether the bug " "has already been reported or already been fixed. If it still seems like your " "bug is unreported, fill out a bug report." msgstr "" "La communauté OpenStack valorise vos efforts d'installation et de test, et " "souhaite donc avoir votre avis. Pour signaler un bogue, vous devrez ouvrir " "un compte sur le Launchpad à https://launchpad.net/+login. Vous pouvez " "visualiser les bogues existants ou rapporter des bogues dans la zone " "réservée aux bogues dans Launchpad. Utilisez la fonction de recherche pour " "déterminer si le bogue a déjà été signalé ou a déjà été corrigé. Si votre " "bogue n'a pas encore été signalé, remplir un rapport de bogue." "The `OpenStack wiki <https://wiki.openstack.org/>`__ contains a broad range " "of topics but some of the information can be difficult to find or is a few " "pages deep. Fortunately, the wiki search feature enables you to search by " "title or content. If you search for specific information, such as about " "networking or OpenStack Compute, you can find a large amount of relevant " "material. More is being added all the time, so be sure to check back often. " "You can find the search box in the upper-right corner of any OpenStack wiki " "page." msgstr "" "OpenStack wiki <https://wiki.openstack.org/>`__ contient un large éventail " "de sujets, mais certaines des informations peuvent être difficiles à trouver " "ou peuvent être enfouies. Heureusement, la fonction de recherche de wiki " "vous permet de rechercher par titre ou par contenu. Si vous recherchez des " "informations spécifiques, telles que des informations sur le réseau ou " "Compute d'Openstack, vous trouverez une grande quantité de contenus " "pertinents. Les informations sont ajoutées en continu, donc vérifiez " "régulièrement. Vous pouvez trouver la case de recherche dans le coin " "supérieur droit de n'importe quelle page de wiki OpenStack." msgid ""msgid "The following Launchpad Bugs areas are available:" msgstr "Les zones de Launchpad Bugs suivantes sont à votre disposition :" msgid "" "The following Linux distributions provide community-supported packages for " "OpenStack:" msgstr "" "Les distributions Linux suivantes fournissent des packages pour Openstack " "pris en charge par la communauté :" "`Installation Guide for openSUSE Leap 42.1 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server " "12 SP1 <http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-obs/>`__" msgstr "" "`Guide d'installation pour openSUSE Leap 42.1 etSUSE Linux Enterprise Server " "12 SP1 <http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-obs/>`__" msgid ""

commit_message:
Make 'signing csr' accept Unicode CA Private key

`x509.operations.sign` method will raise error if text type of
CA Private key is given. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I6803612cc7f2ca8c9910f9c4886dba541c913ec0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/12/331912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _private_bytes(self, private_key): return private_key.private_bytes( encoding=serialization.Encoding.PEM, format=serialization.PrivateFormat.PKCS8, encryption_algorithm=serialization.NoEncryption() ) def test_load_pem_private_key_with_bytes_private_key(self): private_key = self._generate_private_key() private_key = self._private_bytes(private_key) self.assertIsInstance(private_key, six.binary_type) private_key = operations._load_pem_private_key(private_key) self.assertIsInstance(private_key, rsa.RSAPrivateKey) def test_load_pem_private_key_with_unicode_private_key(self): private_key = self._generate_private_key() private_key = self._private_bytes(private_key) private_key = six.text_type(private_key.decode('utf-8')) self.assertIsInstance(private_key, six.text_type) private_key = operations._load_pem_private_key(private_key) self.assertIsInstance(private_key, rsa.RSAPrivateKey)

commit_message:
Merge gerrit jobs for project-config

Both gate-project-config-projects-yaml and gate-project-config-gerrit
test files in gerrit directory, both check ACLs a swell. Let's merge
those into one job since in most cases both need to be run anyway and
the name projects-yaml might be confused with
jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml.

Note that this one leaves the projects tox environment in so that
testing of this change passes.

Change-Id: I34324643c26d0bcf2d24ce1dc51250ad53f2d48f

commit_message:
Support bulk deletion for "flavor/aggregate delete"

Support bulk deletion and error handling for "aggregate delete"
and "flavor delete" commands.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multi-argument-compute

commit_message:
Start and Stop DatasourceDriver in new architecture

PollingDatasourceDriver starts polling once the driver has been
initialized and will never stop polling. This patch enables
PollingDatasourceDriver to start polling after its start() is
called and to stop polling after its stop() is called.

Change-Id: I395e5ddbfa6907cc26d4636eeb1ecbb954baae8d

* Add function get_tempname required for create temporary filename
It has optional arguments: dir and prefix:
dir setup a directory where this file will be created
prefix setup a prefix value of the file

Usage:

    from octane.util import tempfile

    tmp_name = tempfile.get_tempname()

* Adding of contextmanager temp_dir is required for creating of tempdir

Usage:

    from octane.util import tempfile

    with tempfile.temp_dir() as my_tmp_dir:

commit_message:
Add helper functions for work with temp dirs and files

* Add function get_tempname required for create temporary filename
It has optional arguments: dir and prefix:
dir setup a directory where this file will be created
prefix setup a prefix value of the file

Usage:

    from octane.util import tempfile

    tmp_name = tempfile.get_tempname()

* Adding of contextmanager temp_dir is required for creating of tempdir
before code block and removing it upon completion of the block.

Usage:

    from octane.util import tempfile

    with tempfile.temp_dir() as my_tmp_dir:
        # code block
        ...

Change-Id: I20b8a0109a85ef41708fa8c9e7e050b391ed039e
(cherry picked from commit a15d657e65bfde9211794d96df6d7c3fb2baa4ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/12/332212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import absolute_import import contextlib import os import shutil import tempfile def get_tempname(dir=None, prefix=None): kwargs = {} if prefix is not None: kwargs["prefix"] = prefix fd, tmp_file_name = tempfile.mkstemp(dir=dir, **kwargs) os.close(fd) return tmp_file_name @contextlib.contextmanager def temp_dir(): temp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() try: yield temp_dir finally: shutil.rmtree(temp_dir)

commit_message:
Publish proxy APIs deprecation in api ref doc

As first step to deprecate the proxy APIs,
this commit publish the deprecation of proxy APIs
in api ref doc.

Partially implements blueprint deprecate-api-proxies

Change-Id: Ie19ec5e27fef956061786646e8f9cc4e44d8ef0f

subject: Add KMIP Experiment Check to Barbican
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-19 13:34:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/c393d56eba93ccb6fe04116c446eec350cb97376', 'message': "Add KMIP Experiment Check to Barbican

Barbican currently supports a plugin architecture for secret stores.
One such secret store implementation is the KMIP secret store. There
are no checks in place at the moment to test the functionality of
Barbican with this plugin.

This patch creates a new Jenkins job to test Barbican with the KMIP
secret store plugin. The end effect will be running all of Barbican's
functional tests using a KMIP secret store plugin. This change enables
the PyKMIP server to run as part of the devstack setup.

The tests can only be run on the latest code. The older stable
branches for kilo, liberty, and mitaka are not supported because the
necessary devstack plugin code is not backported to those branches.
The KMIP secret store job is experimental for now until tests verify
the correct operation.

Change-Id: I3fc6abe6f34bcb31c9ea01bfd7c7ccfd22b28bcc
Depends-On: Ib804fa97545f14ed866bfd73bb251e85923a2e4e

commit_message:
Add KMIP Experiment Check to Barbican

Barbican currently supports a plugin architecture for secret stores.
One such secret store implementation is the KMIP secret store. There
are no checks in place at the moment to test the functionality of
Barbican with this plugin.

This patch creates a new Jenkins job to test Barbican with the KMIP
secret store plugin. The end effect will be running all of Barbican's
functional tests using a KMIP secret store plugin. This change enables
the PyKMIP server to run as part of the devstack setup.

The tests can only be run on the latest code. The older stable
branches for kilo, liberty, and mitaka are not supported because the
necessary devstack plugin code is not backported to those branches.
The KMIP secret store job is experimental for now until tests verify
the correct operation.

Change-Id: I3fc6abe6f34bcb31c9ea01bfd7c7ccfd22b28bcc
Depends-On: Ib804fa97545f14ed866bfd73bb251e85923a2e4e

commit_message:
Add new project: networking-icc

This project implements an API extension to Neutron in order to
enable L2/L3 connectivity between multiple overlay networks located
in multiple OpenStack clouds. This project re-uses Dragonflow
code base with its SDN controller, run-time database and pub/sub
architecture to provide inter-cloud connection between multiple
ICC (Inter-Cloud Connector) devices. The project in meant to work
with hardware and software (e.g. OVS) forwarders alike.

This project is meant to be used by Tricircle project (Top
OpenStack) providing it a way to connect multiple Botom OpenStacks.

Change-Id: I4c250d3dec79d89a78b823f4c151c0029144273a

Enable storlets to show test_result

This enables to publish .tox/func/log/* in the gerrit result that could
be worth to know how it worked (or failed) at the gate.

Remove deprecated auth_plugin config

Change to use auth_type in trustee group instead.
Closes-Bug: 1592482

commit_message:
Start using pre-prov creds in dsvm-layer4

Since pre-provisioned credentials in Tempest are now stable,
I'd like to use that in the gate, along with dynamic credentials,
to ensure both mechanisms are preserved intact.

Starting with layer4 job that runs against tempest only util we
have further proven reliability.

Depends-on: I9db0154a364cec3214b5cabd8a7766a110c2b973
Change-Id: Id1f89c416b9803b7af73ec964ff484301953472e

commit_message:
Implement Libvirt profile

Deploy bits when running nova-compute + libvirt.

Note: some work will be done in puppet-nova to decouple nova-compute
from libvirt in nova::compute::libvirt class.

Change-Id: I754bfa89ba78a70b4b866598fb1163f4e14807c9
Implements: blueprint refactor-puppet-manifests
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/82/329682/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::profile::base::nova::compute::libvirt # # Nova Compute profile for tripleo # # === Parameters # # [*step*] # (Optional) The current step in deployment. See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') # class tripleo::profile::base::nova::compute::libvirt ( $step = hiera('step'), ) { if $step >= 4 { include ::tripleo::profile::base::nova::compute file { ['/etc/libvirt/qemu/networks/autostart/default.xml', '/etc/libvirt/qemu/networks/default.xml']: ensure => absent, before => Service['libvirt'], } # in case libvirt has been already running before the Puppet run, make # sure the default network is destroyed exec { 'libvirt-default-net-destroy': command => '/usr/bin/virsh net-destroy default', onlyif => '/usr/bin/virsh net-info default | /bin/grep -i "^active:\s*yes"', before => Service['libvirt'], } # Ceph + Libvirt $rbd_ephemeral_storage = hiera('nova::compute::rbd::ephemeral_storage', false) $rbd_persistent_storage = hiera('rbd_persistent_storage', false) if $rbd_ephemeral_storage or $rbd_persistent_storage { $client_keys = hiera('ceph::profile::params::client_keys') $client_user = join(['client.', hiera('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::rbd::cinder_rbd_user_name')]) class { '::nova::compute::rbd': libvirt_rbd_secret_key => $client_keys[$client_user]['secret'], } } # TODO(emilien): Some work needs to be done in puppet-nova to separate nova-compute config # when running libvirt and libvirt itself, so we allow micro-services deployments. if str2bool(hiera('nova::use_ipv6', false)) { $vncserver_listen = '::0' } else { $vncserver_listen = '0.0.0.0' } if $rbd_ephemeral_storage { class { '::nova::compute::libvirt': libvirt_disk_cachemodes => ['network=writeback'], libvirt_hw_disk_discard => 'unmap', vncserver_listen => $vncserver_listen, } } else { class { '::nova::compute::libvirt' : vncserver_listen => $vncserver_listen, } } } }

added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`glance` version ``2.1.0``. specified and there is no redirection the image data will not be saved. usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-namespace-create [--schema <SCHEMA>] [--created-at <CREATED_AT>] [--resource-type-associations <RESOURCE_TYPE_ASSOCIATIONS> [<RESOURCE_TYPE_ASSOCIATIONS> ...]] [--protected [True|False]] [--self <SELF>] [--display-name <DISPLAY_NAME>] [--owner <OWNER>] [--visibility <VISIBILITY>] [--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] <NAMESPACE>**Optional arguments:** ``--schema <SCHEMA>`` ``--created-at <CREATED_AT>`` Date and time of namespace creation. ``--resource-type-associations <RESOURCE_TYPE_ASSOCIATIONS> [<RESOURCE_TYPE_ASSOCIATIONS> ...]`` ``--protected [True|False]`` If true, namespace will not be deletable. ``--self <SELF>`` ``--display-name <DISPLAY_NAME>`` The user friendly name for the namespace. Used by UI if available. ``--owner <OWNER>`` Owner of the namespace. ``--visibility <VISIBILITY>`` Scope of namespace accessibility. Valid values: public, private ``--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>`` Date and time of the last namespace modification. ``--description <DESCRIPTION>`` Provides a user friendly description of the namespace. usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-namespace-update [--created-at <CREATED_AT>] [--protected [True|False]] [--namespace <NAMESPACE>] [--self <SELF>] [--display-name <DISPLAY_NAME>] [--owner <OWNER>] [--visibility <VISIBILITY>] [--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] <NAMESPACE>**Optional arguments:** ``--created-at <CREATED_AT>`` Date and time of namespace creation. ``--protected [True|False]`` If true, namespace will not be deletable. ``--namespace <NAMESPACE>`` The unique namespace text. ``--self <SELF>`` ``--display-name <DISPLAY_NAME>`` The user friendly name for the namespace. Used by UI if available. ``--owner <OWNER>`` Owner of the namespace. ``--visibility <VISIBILITY>`` Scope of namespace accessibility. Valid values: public, private ``--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>`` Date and time of the last namespace modification. ``--description <DESCRIPTION>`` Provides a user friendly description of the namespace. usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-resource-type-associate [--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>] [--name <NAME>] [--properties-target <PROPERTIES_TARGET>] [--prefix <PREFIX>] [--created-at <CREATED_AT>] <NAMESPACE>**Optional arguments:** ``--updated-at <UPDATED_AT>`` Date and time of the last resource type association modification. ``--name <NAME>`` Resource type names should be aligned with Heat resource types whenever possible: http://docs.openstac k.org/developer/heat/template_guide/openstack.html ``--properties-target <PROPERTIES_TARGET>`` Some resource types allow more than one key / value pair per instance. For example, Cinder allows user and image metadata on volumes. Only the image properties metadata is evaluated by Nova (scheduling or drivers). This property allows a namespace target to remove the ambiguity. ``--prefix <PREFIX>`` Specifies the prefix to use for the given resource type. Any properties in the namespace should be prefixed with this prefix when being applied to the specified resource type. Must include prefix separator (e.g. a colon :). ``--created-at <CREATED_AT>`` Date and time of resource type association. specified and there is no redirection the image data will not be saved.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`glance` version ``2.0.0``. specified and there is no redirection the image data will be not be saved. usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-namespace-create <NAMESPACE> <unavailable>``<unavailable>`` Please run with connection parameters set to retrieve the schema for generating help for this command usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-namespace-update <NAMESPACE> <unavailable>``<unavailable>`` Please run with connection parameters set to retrieve the schema for generating help for this command usage: glance --os-image-api-version 2 md-resource-type-associate <NAMESPACE> <unavailable>``<unavailable>`` Please run with connection parameters set to retrieve the schema for generating help for this command specified and there is no redirection the image data will be not be saved.

Features: - Discovery of volumes being attached to a host for many transport protocols. - Removal of volumes from a host. %package doc Summary: Documentation for OpenStack os-brick library BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('oslosphinx') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('Sphinx') }} %description doc OpenStack Cinder brick library for managing local volume attaches. Features: - Discovery of volumes being attached to a host for many transport protocols. - Removal of volumes from a host. commit_message:
Check immutable and update_allowed conflict in schema validation

This doesn't check any user input, but checks the validity of the
schema itself, so better to do it during schema validation.
Note, that now heat engine doesn't start in the case of invalid schema.

Change-Id: Iec5ca304eae780f8c028f7eb59cc7ee8710043a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/51/331651/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate(self, context=None): super(Schema, self).validate() # check that update_allowed and immutable # do not contradict each other if self.update_allowed and self.immutable: msg = _("Options %(ua)s and %(im)s " "cannot both be True") % { 'ua': UPDATE_ALLOWED, 'im': IMMUTABLE} raise exception.InvalidSchemaError(message=msg)
deleted_lines: # check that update_allowed and immutable # do not contradict each other if prop.update_allowed() and prop.immutable(): msg = _("Property %(prop)s: %(ua)s and %(im)s " "cannot both be True") % { 'prop': key, 'ua': prop.schema.UPDATE_ALLOWED, 'im': prop.schema.IMMUTABLE} raise exception.InvalidSchemaError(message=msg)

Add migration list command to compute layer

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 IBM # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import copy from openstackclient.compute.v2 import migration from openstackclient.tests.compute.v2 import fakes as compute_fakes from openstackclient.tests import fakes class TestMigration(compute_fakes.TestComputev2): def setUp(self): super(TestMigration, self).setUp() # Get a shortcut to the ServiceManager Mock self.migration_mock = self.app.client_manager.compute.migrations self.migration_mock.reset_mock() class TestMigrationList(TestMigration): def setUp(self): super(TestMigrationList, self).setUp() self.migration_mock.list.return_value = [fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(compute_fakes.MIGRATION), loaded=True, )] # Get the command object to test self.cmd = migration.ListMigration(self.app, None) def test_service_list(self): arglist = [ '--host', compute_fakes.migration_host, '--status', compute_fakes.migration_status, '--cellname', compute_fakes.migration_cellname ] verifylist = [ ('host', compute_fakes.migration_host), ('status', compute_fakes.migration_status), ('cellname', compute_fakes.migration_cellname) ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.migration_mock.list.assert_called_with( compute_fakes.migration_host, compute_fakes.migration_status, compute_fakes.migration_cellname )

commit_message:
/services?name=<name> API fails when using list_limit

When using list_limit configuration option in Default section of
keystone.conf, the /services?name=<service_name> API fails to find
the service if list_limit value is smaller than the total number
of services and the searched service is not among the first
'list_limit' services. The API should first filter by name and
only afterwards truncate the result list.

Also, this patch fixes setting the 'truncated' attribute of the
driver's hint.limit object when truncating the list outside of
driver_hints.truncated decorator, problem exposed by fixing the
problem described in the first paragraph.

Closes-Bug: #1594482
Change-Id: I832f542c3cb0faf94a1e5bce5a894f7f4d26a8de

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3d3163d22c936552441499ec02952300c922f3c2/nova/network/rpcapi.py

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 18:36:57.000000000', 'files': ['thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/SubAlarmStats.java', 'thresh/src/test/java/monasca/thresh/infrastructure/thresholding/MetricAggregationBoltTest.java'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-thresh/commit/0d80a987db69076aa4338dec06231bb5b0c4b244', 'message': 'Treat empty windows as OK for deterministic alarms

Using the standard case of count(log_message) > 1, getting no
log_message measurements should be treated as OK. However, the old code
uses the emptyWindowObservationThreshold for both deterministic and
non-deterministic alarms which means that there must be 3 empty windows
before the deterministic alarm transitions to OK.

This change cause the evaluation of the Alarm to treat an empty window
as OK for deterministic alarms. So, count(log_message) > 1, getting no

Change-Id: I19a04bf78f907b23ef583409f2def54771c07d72
'}]
commit_message:
Treat empty windows as OK for deterministic alarms

Using the standard case of count(log_message) > 1, getting no
log_message measurements should be treated as OK. However, the old code
uses the emptyWindowObservationThreshold for both deterministic and
non-deterministic alarms which means that there must be 3 empty windows
before the deterministic alarm transitions to OK.

This change cause the evaluation of the Alarm to treat an empty window
as OK for deterministic alarms. So, count(log_message) > 1, getting no
measurements in a window will transition the alarm back to OK

Change-Id: I19a04bf78f907b23ef583409f2def54771c07d72

commit_message:
Support ML2 option to enable security groups

Add support for the ML2 enable_security_group option under [securitygroup]
in ml2_conf.ini. This option is set to True by default and will control
whether or not ACLs are applied to ports and the port binding value for
CAP_PORT_FILTER.

Also, update devstack plugin to set enable_security_group based on
Q_USE_SECGROUP and comment out firewall_driver since it isn't used by OVN.

And finally, add the security group options to the neutron-ovn-db-sync-util
command.

Change-Id: I73ca9a34ea34f781cbec5680b44e98da309365bb
Closes-Bug: #1588935

commit_message:
delete stale ovsdb table entries from mysql db

whenever l2gateway_agnet.ini is reconfigured to the same ovsdb identifier
but different IP, then we need to clean the mysql db entries from earlier
configured ovsdb_identifier and IP.

For Ex: l2gateway_agent is connected to "ovsdb1:10.10.10.10:6632",
but when you change l2gateway_agent.ini to "ovsdb1:20.20.20.20:6632",
then the mysql entries related to "ovsdb1:10.10.10.10:6632" should be cleaned.

Change-Id: I72cd5a5e2ea27c2a6b37865c3517e614f901aecf
Closes-Bug:1588809

commit_message:
Use is_valid_ipv4 from oslo.utils

In module netaddr valid_ipv4 raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv4
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: Ic54f2081575fa256e387e3d4bfb718895b580766

start_date).days while days > 0: start_date = start_date+datetime.timedelta(days=1) date_list.append(start_date) days -= 1 if plan_id is None and len(date_list) == 0: # TODO(hurong): marker prefix = "/%s/" % provider_id return [key[key.find("@")+1:] for key in self._index_section.list_objects( prefix=prefix, marker=marker )] if plan_id is not None and len(date_list) != 0: # TODO(hurong): marker ids = [] for date in date_list: prefix = "/%s/%s" % (plan_id, date) for key in self._index_section.list_objects(prefix=prefix, limit=limit, marker=marker): ids.append(key[key.find("@")+1:]) if len(ids) == limit: return ids if plan_id is None and len(date_list) != 0: # TODO(hurong): marker ids = [] for date in date_list: prefix = "/%s" % date for key in self._index_section.list_objects(prefix=prefix, limit=limit, marker=marker): ids.append(key[key.find("@")+1:]) if len(ids) == limit: return ids if plan_id is not None and len(date_list) == 0: # TODO(hurong): marker prefix = "/%s/" % plan_id return [key[key.find("@")+1:] for key in self._index_section.list_objects( prefix=prefix, limit=limit, marker=marker )] self._index_section,

commit_message:
Updates test with overridden timeout values

Currently there is a test that takes an incredibly
long time because its using the sane defaults
set in code. Over ride these defaults for something much more
reasonable for testing purposes.

Closes-Bug: #1594961

Change-Id: I4232157a0a8c8f0cff9dea77f860efa857442754

commit_message:
set aodh auth_url explicitly

Aodh puppet module defaults the auth_url to localhost
this could cause issues when handling gnocchi* alarms.
Fix to set the explicitly in the templates.

Closes-bug: #1590589

Change-Id: Ib93a3381f3f24efea6a1cf713171cc1a259ee7d0
(cherry picked from commit f3e004ce8380b196d2a250507b3f7ea3093428f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/332110/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Merge tag '6.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 6.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 6.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I94019769a3ebcaba66e8bc1544a3563f325c1735

commit_message:
Add install description for Neutron

In Ceilometer "Installing Manually" chapter, "Enabling Service
Notifications" section, the Neutron modifications description is
missing.

This change is to describe the modification for neutron.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1594305

Change-Id: Ibb6a071a4b4a8dd2d7e30ce33e9b9cc96b345bb7

commit_message:
Revert "Replace locks in volume manager"

This reverts commit fa4442ef89ac09323a62f8270318605e33bc8701.

Ooops!  Turns out you got the mock in place for the main
volume test, problem is there's a bunch of tests routing
through here and in turn leaving a bunch of lock files
behind.

Probably need a fixture in the base test class that everybody
just gets for free.

commit_message:
Destroy the error message after volume was deleted

While a volume was deleted the error message related it
should be destroyed as well.

Change-Id: I441570504c614e499b9a1c78fee978385c95067b
Closes-Bug: #1587534

Remove unused filter

After the patch [1] was merged, the filter [filter:request_id]
is not used anymore. So we should remove it as well from
the api-paste.ini.

commit_message:
approved spec directory

Create approved spec directory for store all specs that been approved in this
release but not been implemented yet.
Through this way, it's no longer required to seperate implemented specs or
non-implemented specs in each release directory. Also possible for
blueprints to plan cross releases.

Change-Id: Iee23d66abcceebfed5fe97b04163de446193ee1d

commit_message:
Create resources for environment

Consider that user may have different environment setting under different
scope. We should create resources for environment, give user ability to
dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry,
or other section in environment file.

blueprint environment-resource

Change-Id: I483fdce00594da631dd40708446b223f45822e17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/32/241432/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================================ Create resources for environment ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/environment-resource Create Environment resources to let user (administrator for a spicific scope) register their own environemnt. Problem description =================== Consider that user may have different environment setting under different scope. Current design didn't give administrator to scope spicific environment. We should create resources for environment, give user ability to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section in environment file. Proposed change =============== * Create resources for environment, give user ability to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section in environment file. 1. Environment Resource registry Namespace: OS::Heat::EnvironmentResourceRegistry Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt resource registry. String value. Update allowed. resource_type: Namespace for resource to registry. String value. Update allowed. resource_template: Template file. Map value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment resource registry. String value. Update allowed. 2. Environment Parameter Namespace: OS::Heat::EnvironmentParameters Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt parameter. String value. Update allowed. parameter_key: Key for parameter. String value. Update allowed. parameter_value: Value for parameter. String value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment parameter. String value. Update allowed. 3. Environment Namespace: OS::Heat::Environment Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt. String value. Update allowed. parameters: A set of parameter for this environment. List value. Update allowed. resource_registry: A set of resource_registry for this environment. List value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment. String value. Update allowed. scope: Define Scope for environment. Map value. Update allowed. force: Force to overwrite. Boolean value. Update allowed. * Create Database schema for Environment Environment topology for Environment resources. 1. environment table_name: environment Colume: ------- id: Environement object ID. Integer value. Primary key. name: Environment name. Name for environment. String value. description: Environemnt description. String value. scope: Environemnt scope. Json value. force: Forcec to replace environemt parameter or registry. Boolean value. 2. resource_registry table_name: resource_registry Colume: ------- id: Resource registry object id. Integer value. Primary key. environment: Environment for this registry. Foreign key. name: Resource registry name. String value. description: Environemnt resource registry description. String value. resource_type: Resource type. String value. resource_template: template for resource. String value. 3. environment parameter table_name: environment_parameter Colume: ------- id: Parameter object id. Integer value. Primary key. key: Parameter key. String value. value: Parameter value. String value. environment: Environment for this parameter. Foreign key. name: Parameter name. String value. description: Environemnt parameter description. String value. * Change to load environment base on environment resource. Environment can be writen on environment file or given by stack condition, and now it can create by environment resoruces. This implement will load environment file as basic environment resources. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rico Lin <rico-lin> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka-1 Work Items ---------- * Create resources for environment * Create Database schema for Environment * Change Environment to load from database. * Add rule for check environment scope. * Add test * Add sample in document Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Composable roles within services - NTP - Compute

Add NTP as a composable service for compute nodes.

Partially-implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles

Change-Id: I53958a660830211dee731e0129f4ff018c0cd853

commit_message:
add l3 cache usage meter

Some Intel processor families (e.g. the Intel Xeon processor E5 v3
family) introduced CMT (Cache Monitoring Technology) to measure the
usage of l3 cache (last level cache) by applications running on the
platform. This spec introduces one new meter to get l3 cache usage
statistics based on Intel CMT feature.

Implements: blueprint l3-cache-meter
Change-Id: I7f38e80776e1e55533b33e9c72dcab6d3c12abb4

commit_message:
Clean up container cache prep in tests

This patch cleans up the container cache preparation in the tests
due to the following patches:

- https://review.openstack.org/307856 (new image build process)
- https://review.openstack.org/315114 (new apt config process)
- https://review.openstack.org/322188 (new resolver config process)

Change-Id: I7b780e23bb4f642514783050c09bc755eb36e75f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/69/331269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - { src: '/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99unauthenticated', dest: '/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99unauthenticated' } - name: Determine the existing Ubuntu repo configuration shell: 'awk "/^deb .*ubuntu\/? {{ ansible_distribution_release }} main/ {print \$2; exit}" /etc/apt/sources.list' register: ubuntu_repo changed_when: false - name: Set apt repo facts based on discovered information set_fact: lxc_container_template_main_apt_repo: "{{ ubuntu_repo.stdout }}" lxc_container_template_security_apt_rep: "{{ ubuntu_repo.stdout }}" lxc_container_caches: - url: "https://rpc-repo.rackspace.com/container_images/rpc-trusty-container.tgz" name: "trusty.tgz" sha256sum: "56c6a6e132ea7d10be2f3e8104f47136ccf408b30e362133f0dc4a0a9adb4d0c" chroot_path: trusty/rootfs-amd64

commit_message:
Modals should inherit from the theme

* Fullscreen Modals have been removed
  These weren't working properly anyways, and the styling is very
  unpleasant: https://i.imgur.com/QfvGli7.png

* Added two more modal sizes: xs and xl, and added all modals sizes
  to the theme preview page.  Also updated the theme preview page
  to use fa-close instead of 'x'.

* Cleaned up Spinner css to use modal sizes properly.  Themability
  of spinner to come later.

* Confirmation Modal JavaScript was cleaned up, and contents turned
  into an easier to digest client side template. Themability of
  client side templates show cased in 'material' design.

* 'material' confirmation dialog was altered to show how themes can
  make use of overriding client-side templates.

* Moved the Bootstrap helper variables into its own file.

* Added helper variables for various modal calculations.

Change-Id: I599ad2ffcf3034a24a19bc87e6ebed3eab079f45

commit_message:
Mask password on agent lookup according to policy

We currently mask passwords in driver_info for all API responses,
except for agent lookups. This is because driver_vendor_passthru
just expects a dict to return as JSON in the response, and doesn't
modify it at all.

Change lookup to follow the defined policy when returning the node
object in the response, the same way we do for other API responses.

Co-authored-by: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>

Change-Id: Ib19d2f86d3527333e905fdbf1f09fc3dc8b8c5a7
Closes-Bug: #1572796
(cherry picked from commit 426a306fb580762e97ada04e1253dedd9b64d410)

added_lines: import copy def _test_lookup_v2(self, find_mock, show_password=True): self.context.show_password = show_password # NOTE(jroll) apparently as_dict() returns a dict full of references expected = copy.deepcopy(self.node.as_dict()) if not show_password: expected['driver_info']['ipmi_password'] = '******' self.assertEqual(expected, node['node']) def test_lookup_v2_show_password(self): self._test_lookup_v2(show_password=True) def test_lookup_v2_hide_password(self): self._test_lookup_v2(show_password=False) self.context.show_password = True expected = copy.deepcopy(self.node.as_dict()) 'node_uuid': 'fake-uuid', self.assertEqual(expected, node['node']) mock_get_node.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'fake-uuid')
deleted_lines: def test_lookup_v2(self, find_mock): self.assertEqual(self.node.as_dict(), node['node']) 'node_uuid': 'fake uuid', self.assertEqual(self.node.as_dict(), node['node']) mock_get_node.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'fake uuid')

We currently mask passwords in driver_info for all API responses,

Change lookup to follow the defined policy when returning the node
object in the response, the same way we do for other API responses.

commit_message:
Mask password on agent lookup according to policy

We currently mask passwords in driver_info for all API responses,
except for agent lookups. This is because driver_vendor_passthru
just expects a dict to return as JSON in the response, and doesn't
modify it at all.

Change lookup to follow the defined policy when returning the node
object in the response, the same way we do for other API responses.

Co-authored-by: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>

Change-Id: Ib19d2f86d3527333e905fdbf1f09fc3dc8b8c5a7
Closes-Bug: #1572796

commit_message:
Added heat.resource_type custom constraint

This constraint will validate that a parameter value is a valid resource
type within the context of the template (that is, taking into account
the environment file(s) passed in as well).

Change-Id: I82b18d52982c2731370df9ea4ea0e398bf7702f2
Closes-Bug: #1545857

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from heat.common import exception from heat.engine.constraint import heat_constraints as hc from heat.tests import common class ResourceTypeConstraintTest(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(ResourceTypeConstraintTest, self).setUp() self.constraint = hc.ResourceTypeConstraint() self.mock_template = mock.MagicMock() self.mock_env = mock.MagicMock() self.mock_template.env = self.mock_env def test_validate(self): # Setup value = ['OS::Heat::None'] # Test result = self.constraint.validate(value, None, self.mock_template) # Verify self.assertTrue(result) self.mock_env.get_class.assert_called_once_with(value[0]) def test_validate_failure(self): # Setup value = ['OS::Heat::None'] self.mock_env.get_class.side_effect = Exception() # Test e = self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, self.constraint.validate, value, None, self.mock_template) # Verify self.assertTrue('OS::Heat::None' in e.message) self.mock_env.get_class.assert_called_once_with(value[0]) def test_validate_multiple_failures(self): # Setup value = ['OS::Heat::None', 'OS::Heat::RandomString'] self.mock_env.get_class.side_effect = [Exception(), Exception()] # Test e = self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, self.constraint.validate, value, None, self.mock_template) # Verify self.assertTrue('OS::Heat::None,OS::Heat::RandomString' in e.message) self.mock_env.get_class.assert_has_calls([mock.call(value[0]), mock.call(value[1])])

commit_message:
Remove duplicate unit test resource tracker

Removes the test class that tested the "periodic update resource"
functionality in test_resource_tracker.py. This wasn't testing any code
paths that were not already being tested by test_tracker.py's
TestUpdateComputeNode and TestUpdateAvailableResource test case classes.

Change-Id: Ie7c565ebb39c4644a304f53a73853d6ca51b1334

commit_message:
add FIXME tag for extra argument 'topic' in scheduler rpc api

Some functions in scheduler rpc api receive unused argument
'topic'. We can't fix it now as we may interact with old services.
It can only be fixed when we do a major version bump and drop the
old compatibility. Now we add two FIXME tags in case we forget it
one day.

Change-Id: Iafd60bb51a2d7c8eab909d35f4b4de120a1172bb
Partial-Bug: #1593149

subject: provide a replacement for the deprecated isotime()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-14 11:29:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/86fc7b632a8697247e35dba517fcf04a82438104', 'message': 'un-deprecate (resurrect) timeutils.isotime

This change proposes a new timeutils.isotime() to replace the earlier
one which was scheduled for deprecation.

Several issues with the old isotime() function became apparent in
reviewing the steps required to handle the deprecation of
isotime(). These are detailed in the bug 1592181.

I strongly urge all reviewers to read the bug (referenced) and the
comments as part of the review.

WARNING: This code as proposed could introduce inconsistencies in the
way in which isotime() returns results. Specifically, these two
situations are known.

1. If you provide isotime() with a timestamp that includes timezone
information, the old isotime() would wilfully ignore it, the new one
will produce offset information in the resulting string. If the
timezone is UTC, you will get the 'Z' suffix, if it is non-UTC, you
will get the full 6 character offset +/-hh:mm.

2. If you provide isotime with the subsecond parameter the old
isotime() returned the (im)PERFECT_TIMESTAMP_FORMAT which included
subsecond information but NO timezone information. The new isotime()
returns timezone information. If the timezone is UTC, you will get the
'Z' suffix, if it is non-UTC, you will get the full 6 character offset
+/-hh:mm.

In addition, a behavior which makes this implementation of isotime()
differ from the original is that if you provide isotime() with a
timestamp that includes invalid timezone information (such as an
offset greater than one day) then isotime() will throw a
ValueError. The old isotime() was wilfully unaware and you wouldn't
get such an exception.

Tests have been proposed which exercise the new isotime() function.

Note also that the change set adds timeutils.utcnow_aware() which is
similar to datetime.datetime.utcnow() but returns an aware
timestamp. For a description of aware and naive timestamps, refer:
https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/datetime.html.

The term "wilfully unaware" that I use in the description above is
non-standard. It is not the same as 'naive'. Rather, 'wilfully
unaware' indicates code that knowingly treats timestamps as naive
without checking or making any consideration for whether they are
aware or naive.

I believe that this code, warts and all is better than having multiple
buggy copies of isotime() in each project; each just slightly
different from the other to make your skin crawl. It is generally
advisable when you have bad apples, to put them all together and away
from the good ones. This change attempts to do that.

Change-Id: Ifb367a1f96a663a1d54b1770b9d20bbffdba491c
Related: Ic5abf6669edd4f1a9fd62e61f437565aa887aebe
Closes-Bug: #1592181
